story:
Dear Friend,

For the past five years the Pilipino Workers Center and I have put together this small toy drive. We are doing it again this year for the sixth time. On December 2015, we will be distributing toys to the low income families that live in the Larry Itliong Village, the home of the Pilipino Workers Center in the heart of Historic Filipinotown in Los Angeles.

I have seen amazing things happen - Filipinos and Latinos working together side by side to make the holidays a little brighter for the children of this community.

The holidays are coming up fast and this year I hope to show the world that we can do something to prevent the senseless violence among our youth. Please help me make this year’s toy drive possible. Let’s bring back hope for our youth with a small gesture that will go a long way to brighten these children’s holidays.

Thank you,

James Castillo
Volunteer Coordinator
2015 Toy Drive
626-241-7010
flowermanproductions@gmail.com

Flowerman Productions
PO Box 261039
Los Angeles, CA 90026
www.flowermanproductions.com

story:
Hola!

We are Blake Ruiz and Mindy Babcock, and we are here to ask for your help with our new project! We are a travel photography and blogging duo, and we are starting a project called PermacultureD.This project is focused on documenting permaculture as a sustainable way of feeding the community. We want to learn about this style of agriculture and share it with the world by self-publishing a photobook based around permaculture.

  Blake, 27, has been capturing moments through his lense for the past six years, and selling prints for the last two. He currently has prints displayed and for sale in Salida, Colorado. He also has recently co-founded a travel blog with Mindy. You can see his photography here: (http://blakeruizphotography.communityofculture.com/).

Mindy, 23, has lived in Colorado her whole life, and has a strong passion for mother nature and the community. Normally armed with a camera and a notepad, she is finally spreading her wings to be the change she wishes to see. She started by writing and co-founding a blog with Blake about her travels across the Pacific Northwest, Canada, Montana, and Yellowstone National Park. You can see their blog at YESPLZKTHNX.COM.

We are teaming up with Bona Fide for eight weeks starting December 10th. Bona Fide is a 26 acre permaculture farm, located on Isla Ometepe (Island of Twin Volcanoes), which is located in Nicaragua. With a focus on agro-ecology, experienced based learning, and food sovereignty, it is a model for the possibilities of self-sustainable systems. Their vision is to provide people with the necessary knowledge and skills to empower them to produce their own food in a more sustainable manner, and live more intentionally in their own environments. You can check them out at projectbonafide.com.

The Why and The What

We have accepted that there is a disconnect within our society and nature, with each other and resources needed to survive and thrive. We are looking to find a better way of living in relation to our planet, the food it produces, and one another. We accept that the earth will not be healed tomorrow, that agriculture, nutrition, and societal issues will not be changed the day after, but we are here to be a part of the change we wish to see in the world. 

On December 10th, our learning experience will begin. For 8 weeks we are going to get our hands dirty, put our brains to work, and learn and share our experience with the world. We will learn about living sustainably, permaculture systems, farm life, growing our own food, and feeding the community. We are going to share the whole experience on our blog YESPLZKTHNX. Upon returning we are going to write and self-publish a photo book about the trip. The purpose of the book is to spread awareness of permaculture by telling an intimate story through the eyes of a firsthand experience. 

Picture this...your friend sits down on your super comfy couch and out of the corner of their eye, a book catches their attention. BUT, not just any book. A beautifully bonded book, casted with one simple word, 'PermacultureD'. Upon opening this book, a story is told one page at a time. With lay-flat pages providing a seamless experience of panoramas of our adventure and the experience of a hands-on learning environment. Your friend will be swept into a world that they might not know anything about. This is where you come in! You followed the entire journey on the blog and learned the basics of permaculture and how it can be applied, so you share your tid-bit of knowledge. Then, you send them to YESPLZKTHX.com andprojectbonafide.com, and the cycle is complete. In a world where electronic devices rule the power, printed media could make a major difference in the ability to catch people's attention long enough to teach them something that could have a great impact on the world. 


What We Need

The time we spend volunteering, learning, and sharing is very valuable but the trip will not be free. There are travel expenses, living expenses, printing costs, and a donation for Bona Fide to come up with. We need your support to make this happen. We have already purchased our plane ticket and set up our stay with Bona Fide, but we are not fully prepared to take on the rest of the expenses. Expenses like our travel home, donation for Bona Fide, and printing costs for the book are still unaccounted for, but with your help, we will easily get there. Here's a little break-down to give you an idea of what our expenses look like.

----------------------------

Travel Expenses- $1,640
Living Expenses- $2,860
Crowdfunding Expenses- $4,133
---------------------------------------
Subtotal - $8,633
Donation - $1,000
IndieGoGo (approx. 10%) - $963
---------------------------------------
TOTAL - $10,596

-Our travel expenses include plane tickets, other transportation, hostels, and food.
-Living expenses include our room and board and well as food for 8 weeks.
-Crowdfunding expenses include the perks YOU will receive upon making a donation. You can look to the right to see what these goodies are.
-A donation to Bona Fide will be given to go towards any future or current projects that need little extra umph to make happen.
-Annnddd, finally, in case ya didn't know, IndieGoGo isn't free to use. They have employees to pay and babies to feed. They take 5% and card processing is another 3-5%.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have money to help us out? That's totally bueno, here are some other ways you can help. Share us on your Facebook, tell your friends, tell your neighbors, tell your grandma. You can not expect change in the world if you don't have a little conversation. Encourage others to do the same! We appreciate all the help because we can’t do it without you! Thanks ya'll!

story:
This barn sits on a 32 acre public park in Perry Twp, Stark County Ohio.   We are raising funds to establish a bonefide 501c3 organization titled, "Friends of the Fasnacht Farm Park."  Our misssion is to preserve and develop the Fasnacht Farm Park to benefit the community by providing a gathering place for meetings, workshops and market farmers. 


The problem:  Although this is a public park, our Township is lacking the funding needed to move this project along.   The elements are taking a toll on the property and repairs are desperately needed to halt the deterioration and preserve the history at this location.  This property is very unique in its history and location.  It has a lot to offer in teaching the agricultural history of the area as well as the history of the Ohio canal system.  
We need to have 501c3 status in order to apply for grants and seek public  contributions.  
We seek 501c3 status so we can solicit neighbors and others to contribute to our campaign to save the current structures from the elements.  Our objectives are as follows:
*To repair and make stable current structures, barns and outbuildings including 1800's farmhouse. (paint, roof repairs, electrical upgrade)
*Level concrete floor in garage to provide meeting place for Community gardeners and others. (concrete  leveling)
*Install picnic pavilion perhaps with the help of the Timber Framers Guild. 
*Install cement floor in machine shed to facilitate larger group meetings and events by providing cover from the elements. 
*Grade and improve stone driveway and parking area. 
*Provide any other improvements that would increase the public use capacity of the Farm park. 

Your help is greatly appreciated.

story:
Our center consist of a small meditation and ceremony hall, an office and a library of Buddhist and spirituality works. All services are free of charge, all our staff are unpaid volunteers from the floor up to the management. As a community of yogi’s we deliver the method and practice to the public. The center was originaly founded by the late Thai monk Phra Kru Kraisonvilasa Mettavihari in 1986.

Our aim is to provide to anybody being in Amsterdam those are seeking for spiritual relief, regardless of status and financial ability, to find a place for contemplation and development of insight on a nonprofit basis.

This year our centre will undergo renovation, at the same time we take the opportunity to refurbish the interior. For the interior an estimated budget of $6000 is needed, whereby around $ 2000 is expected to be raised by your donations. The refurbishing will consist of painting the walls, carpeting, cabinets for the library, office desks and utilities. Any amount of donation is welcome, and may it bring more happines and goodness to yourself.

Please help us fulfill this project.

story:
Who We Are:

The New England Aces (NEA) is a group for asexual spectrum individuals and allies that provides support in an open and affirming environment, builds community based on friendship and respect, and promotes awareness of asexual spectrum identities in the New England area through outreach, trainings, and collaboration with community partners. 

NEA is committed to values of inclusiveness, intersectionality, and social justice.  We welcome members of diverse sexual and romantic orientations, gender identities, race, religions, nationalities, socioeconomic backgrounds, and abilities. 


What We Are Doing:

We're participating in the Boston Pride Parade for the second time as an organization this year to celebrate our identities and show support for everyone attending and participating in Pride.  This is also a great opportunity for us to reach out to asexuals and allies alike by providing informational resources and visibility.  By donating, you'll help us spread awareness of asexuality and promote pride in who we are as asexual spectrum individuals.


What We Need:

By donating to our Make Boston Pride Asexy! campaign, you'll be ensuring we have:

  • Registration for the Pride Parade.
  • Signs and a banner for those marching in the Pride Parade to express our enjoyment of who we are, loud and proud. 
  • Water and sunscreen for marchers.

  • Paying fees associated with our Meetup.com site to continue our community building and outreach

Funds exceeding our goal amount will go towards providing resources - educational pamphlets, trainings, and ace swag - to local organizations which serve as resources or service providers to sexual minority folks.


What *You* Get:

We're thankful for every dollar of support we receive.  To show our thanks, we have rewards at convenient donation levels to choose from:

  • $1 - A thank you shout out via NEA's twitter and facebook
  • $5 - A thank you card mailed to you and signed with personal messages of gratitude from NEA members
  • $10 - A choice of one ace swag button from our NEA Zazzle shop
  • $20 - A choice of one large, heavy duty ace swag sticker from our NEA Zazzle shop
  • $50 - A choice of one ace swag mug from our NEA Zazzle shop, or any combination of rewards equal in value
  • $100 - A choice of one ace swag t-shirt from our NEA Zazzle shop, or any combination of rewards equal in value
  • $250 - Any combination of rewards equal in value and listing as an official sponsor of NEA on our website


Other Ways You Can Help:

Support comes in all shapes and sizes.  Here are some options for helping New England Aces continue to live up to our mission of providing support of asexual spectrum folks, raising awareness of asexuality, and collaborating with community partners.

  • Become a member of New England Aces!  See meetup.com/newenglandaces for details
  • Help us get the word out by sharing this campaign widely across your twitter, facebook, google+, tumblr, and other social media
  • Send us an email at newenglandaces@gmail.com with your ideas, suggestions, questions, or requests


Thanks!  Happy Pride!

story:
STEM The FUTURE Available NOW to the NEXT GENERATION of Space Explorers, Scientists, Engineers. Architecture for conforming meshes of Carbon C60 Developing New Technologies for Disaster and Emergency Management. 

For Our Military and Defense .

Full Body Suit for Protection in harsh environments. Space, Arctic, Ocean. Providing a Full Body Armor that is flexible and lightweight for Fire Fighting, Space, Defense applications. 

Exoskeleton for Paralyzed mobility, added mechanical Strength.
Architecture for conforming meshes made of Carbon C60

    INCA Architecture= Future NOW

NEW STEM kits will spark student curiosity from k-12; to expand their knowledge of Nano science as the foundation of matter, to prepare students to understand and Create new technologies developed from Nano, this size of science, which includes their cell phones and computers. leading to new technologies, and engineering new structures for our future NOW!

PLANETARY HABITAT, MOBILE HOSPITAL, EMERGENCY SHELTER

 

ARTIFICIAL ORGANS, HEART, LUNGS, LIMBS

SPACE RING FOR SPACE STATION BUILD

STEM learning in grades K-5 is GEOMETRY. INCA Architecture MAKES ALL 5 PLATONIC SOLIDS Students can Build Their Imagination HELP PROVIDE THEM THE MOST ADVANCED TOOL INCA KITS!

If students aren't shown this connection to nature at an early age, they will never be curious or be drawn to scientific research or the higher math.

Make The Difference

Enable the development of next generation particle-in-cell tools, including the use of GEOMETRY confirming meshes for advanced, computer architectures!
As contributors, you will help achieve the goal of providing accurate, flexible models for students of all ages in the classrooms, Labs, Colleges advancing the ability of teachers to stimulate a deeper understanding of 'how nature works' .

EASY ASSEMBLY NO TOOLS. TRY THAT IN SPACE!

  • INCA STEM kits are designed to model nature from the atomic and molecular scale with flexible motions showing the patterns and relationships of energy movement before it becomes matter.

  • DNA LIKE CODE creating Self Assembling structures and NANO machines

  • NEXT GENERATION STEM INCA (inter nodal connector architecture) kits will "Stimulate a child's creative inquiry, and unlock the questions about a subject, leading the child to look for answers that can solve problems, while also discovering new possibilities and paths to explore.  This allows the child to ask 'WHY and WHY NOT' as they progress, which starts their creative inquiry.  We need to be able to answer their questions about NATURE, how it is all connected, how the energy at the nano-scale becomes mass that forms matter, with models that look like atoms, and can model all elements of the periodic table as the get older.  Nature is not square or rigid, therefore, these accurate flexible models will allow students to see the patterns and relationships in nature with accuracy.

  • The STEM directorate wants students to pick a world problem and find a solution that involves science, technology, engineering, and math, without any specific content or facts.  It is no wonder teachers are confused.  Solving this dichotomy has required several re-writes of the first 'Nano in Nature k-5' series of interactive textbooks. 

  •  The author: Judith Light Feather, President of The Nano Technology Group is launching the latest edition of the series: 'The Magic of the Nano World' as a Perk with a PDF file download link. 

  • The newest version has added suggestions for Art projects to stimulate students creativity and deeper understanding of the interactive resources provided. The k-5 grades are the most creative years for learning and the art helps them express their creativity and how they relate to the world.

  •  These tools will lead the way for a New Generation, to not only Create a New Future, but in doing so, engineer entire NEW industries. 

  •  It will help teachers to challenge students to keep asking questions and to find the answers from the 'bottom up' instead of waiting for directions from the 'top down'.  This combination of resources is designed to 'respect our teachers' and help them to present creative content and introduce STEM as the study of Nature. 

    What We Need & What You Get

  • Funding needs for manufacturing the STEM kits:
    $30,000 - 4- cavity Injection Mold Tooled for production. Design Shown here.

  • $80,000 - to manufacture 3000 retail STEM Science Education Model Kits.
  • Each kit will contain 60 nodes, in colors which replicate atoms, and 100 color connecting struts,  along with graphic directions for students.
  •  Step 1, The donations you give will be used to fund the molding, casting, production, Marketing, packaging and shipping of the product. The first $30,000 will fund the Injection mold in preparation for manufacturing the kits.  
  • Step 2, will be the design of the boxes and graphics for students, as we get ready for production.
  • Step 3, manufacturing stage, we will actively work with our factory to make sure that everything is up to our standards.
  •  in addition a link will be provided to download PDF file of the latest 'Nano in Nature k-5' series of Interactive textbooks. possibly a CD or DVD in each kit.  
  • Parents and teachers can pre-order their kits for $40.00 donations which includes USA shipping. 
  • Schools can order multiple kits of 10 or more with a 35% discount.  
  • Any donations are also welcome for anyone who would like to help with this education project.
  • Any amount over the goal will be used for increasing the Marketing and manufacturing of the kits.  We will keep working towards larger production runs, to keep up with the orders.  
  • The Impact-  The ability for students, teachers, parents and/or schools to buy a STEM kit that actually mimics nature at the atomic level where energy forms matter - will stimulate the creativity in young students to develop an interest for deeper understanding of nature as they mature.  Science in all fields is the study of nature, leading to new technologies, and engineering structures for our future. 

  • Remember: Other Modeling Kits are Square and Rigid plastic, which do not mimic nature.  INCA STEM kits are designed to model nature from the atomic and molecular scale with flexible motions showing the patterns and relationships of energy movement before it becomes matter.

  • Watch the exciting videos of the students using the INCA Scientific model at the INCAnaut challenge!  https://www.facebook.com/INCAnautChallenge

THE TEAM

Ralph Maunder - Principal Engineer OF Image Dynamic LLC
U.S. Navy Veteran. Navy Trained: Naval Submarine school;
Electronics A, Missile Fire Control, Radar, and Radio systems schools.

  • Manufacture of INCA Scientific model http://www.amodelkit.com
    seen here throughout the campaign 

Judith Light Feather - President of The Nano Technology Group
The author of 'Nano in Nature k-5' Series, 'The Magic of the Nano World'

 

Steve Bridgers - Inventor of INCA patent #6869246

U.S. Navy Veteran

Manufacture of INCA Scientific model for Science and Engineering 

A A Global Manufacture

  • Image Dynamic LLC  under license of patent #6869246 by Steve Bridgers, made the 1st prototypes of the INCA Scientific model shown in Baltimore, Maryland USA
Manufacture selected for INCA STEM Science Education Model Kit

RB Toy Design, Inc.

Risks & Challenges

  • We have already tested the INCA Scientific model with students, who found them to be an exciting experience and are waiting for the final production. The models were successfully tested at the 'INCAnaut Challenge' by students at the Harrisburg University of Science and Technology, Pennsylvania, 
    The models were successfully tested at the 'Army STEM Experience' in Washington, DCWe have funded and manufactured the INCA Scientific model and all the tests have been successful.
  • The current model kits available for study are not flexible, therefore do not mimic nature at any scale of science. Your contributions to fund these INCA STEM Science Education Models as the new technology in the classrooms  changes the way students learn science from the Planck scale to the cosmos.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this information on your Social Media platforms.  The sooner we reach the first manufacturing goal, the faster you will receive your model kits.
  • If you cannot donate or pre-order a kit, please pass the links for our campaign on to friends, family and co-workers who might be interested. We look forward to your help in spreading the word and 'Thank YOU in advance for your enthusiasm and gracious support.

story:
Our dream is to build apartment hotels with a social cause worldwide - all based on the same concept: offering an exceptional stay and earning a healthy profit to invest in childrens future.

Social Hotels will offer great value, superb service and warm hospitality. We'll not be the first crowdsourced hotel, but our strategy is absolutely unique, with a focus on the triple bottom line, society, the environment, as well as financials:

  1. Support of children's future: Every cent of our hotels net profit goes directly to charity projects for children worldwide. Every child has the right to be happy, healthy, protected and loved

  2. Locally-Sourced Merchandise: We want to sell branded products in our hotel from the reception shop, however, strictly those that are produced and handmade by the locals; to create jobs and promote the community.

  3. Staff Support: Our hotel will provide employment and social returns for the local community. 


Croatia is a popular tourist destination and tourism ist fast growing. We want to use this touristic potential to generate healthy cashflows in order to invest in children charity organisation.  


Anyone who had the opportunity to explore Croatia will sure tell you that it is a traveller's paradise. With its many isles this is an alluring place to be in. Stunning coast, breath-taking scenery, fabulous architecture and of course - the amazing food and wine! Being a traveler in Croatia does not mean you will not feel like home. Quite opposite. Once you enter this exquisite country, it will feel like a home-away-from-home. You will become addicted to Croatia. And yes. You will fall in love with this place. Do not say we didn't warn you. 


Read here more about Croatia.


We were looking at many different locations adequate for a 20 rooms aparthotel, wrote a 30 page business plan to ensure we had our strategy and numbers just right, and prepared for all of the difficult and complicated Croatian laws. And, we are almost ready to start, but, there are still a few obstacles to overcome:

  • Finance: Our aparthotel will consist of approx. 20 rooms  in a relaxed and intimate setting. The total investment in land, buildings and other assets would be around $ 1'350,000. This sum will be sourced through crowdfunding, donations, private loans and investments.

Through crowdfunding we want to raise at least 50% of the total investment amount needed. We start here on Indiegogo with amount of $ 80'000 needed for land and property purchase. If we collect more money from the initial goal we'll use it for remodelling of the facilities in order to create comfortable and spacious rooms. To cut costs, one part of renovations work and repairs will be done with our own labour as well as friends. However, things like buying the furniture, the mattresses, and new linens, require some seed capital.

Location: - There are 2 possible locations - Dalmatia and Istria

  1. Dalmatia- Our first target is to make this hotel in Dalmatia. Everybody say that nowhere in Croatia can boast beaches like those of Dalmatia. The region has the perfect combination of that distincitve Croatien light, unspoiled landscapes, colours and fragrances. And the glorious natural setting is complemented by the rich culinary fare of the region and the living religious traditions of its people, manifested in a host of feast days and other ceremonies and rituals. 

  2. Istria - Our second target is to make this hotel by the beautiful beaches placed at the foot of Mountain Učka. It's a unique place combining from one hand climbing, mountain walks, biking and from the other hand sea sports, swimming and many relaxing sea bars or even vivid nightlife!f   

  • Hotel name: A list of 5 names will be announced as soon as we have purchased a property.  You're be able to vote the name of our hotel through our website www.socialhotels.org. 


Supporters who become part of this project will be rewarded with awesome gifts and travel vouchers over the invested sum to be used for a stay at our Social Hotel in Croatia. You can use it for yourself or surprise your loved ones with this unusual gifts. See perks for more details:




Please find detailed information about travel voucher's terms and conditions here.


We are helping children suffering from poverty, exploitation or violence worldwide. Along with our local project partners we seek solutions when children live in the street, work under inhuman conditions or have to prostitute themselves, and when a war has destroyed their health or their homes. We support women, families and communities in caring for their children and we help young people to build a future beyond violence and poverty.


We are a modern, networked organization of qualified experts and social entrepreneurs. Our team is made up of 6 loyal and experienced professionals who dedicate their spare time to Social Hotel. When we had opened our first hotel, we intend to hire more employees to manage, monitor and advise on a continuous  basis.


This past season, we also ran a successful small business renting apartments and homes within our network through our various online sales travel platforms. We surprise ourselves with our own success, because this last summer was extremely busy, the guests required a lot from us, and at the end of it we left with a new appreciation of what we loved to do, and what we can do even better for next year!


If you can’t make a donation at this time, there are still ways you can help! Please take a few moments and share our campaign with your friends and family, via social media, email, and through word of mouth!

Thank you in advance for your support and generous donations! Let's make this real together!


Our Project in other languages:

                                            

 DEUTSCH                    FRANÇAIS                   ESPAÑOL                  РУССКИЙ

as friends. However, things like buying the furniture, the
mattresses, and new linens, require some seed capital.




Location: -
There are 2 possible locations - Dalmatia and Istria



Dalmatia-
	Our first target is to make this hotel in Dalmatia. Everybody say
	that nowhere in Croatia can boast beaches like those of Dalmatia.
	The region has the perfect combination of that distincitve Croatien
	light, unspoiled landscapes, colours and fragrances. And the
	glorious natural setting is complemented by the rich culinary fare
	of the region and the living religious traditions of its people,
	manifested in a host of feast days and other ceremonies and
	rituals. 


Istria - Our
	second target is to make this hotel by the beautiful beaches placed
	at the foot of Mountain Učka. It's a unique place combining from
	one hand climbing, mountain walks, biking and from the other hand
	sea sports, swimming and many relaxing sea bars or even vivid
	nightlife!f   




Hotel
	name: A
	list of 5 names will be announced as soon as we have purchased a
	property.  You're be able to vote the name of our hotel through
	our website www.socialhotels.org. 








Supporters
who become part of this project will be rewarded with awesome gifts
and travel vouchers over the invested sum to be used for a stay at
our Social Hotel in Croatia. You can use it for yourself or surprise
your loved ones with this unusual gifts. See perks for more details:















Please
find detailed information about travel voucher's terms and
conditions here.


We
are helping children suffering from poverty, exploitation or violence
worldwide. Along with our local project partners we seek
solutions when children live in the street, work under inhuman
conditions or have to prostitute themselves, and when a war has
destroyed their health or their homes. We support women, families and
communities in caring for their children and we help young people to
build a future beyond violence and poverty.



We
are a modern, networked organization of qualified experts and social
entrepreneurs. Our team is made up of 6 loyal and experienced
professionals who dedicate their spare time to Social Hotel. When we
had opened our first hotel, we intend to hire more employees to
manage, monitor and advise on a continuous  basis.



This
past season, we also ran a successful small business renting
apartments and homes within our network through our various online
sales travel platforms. We surprise ourselves with our own success,
because this last summer was extremely busy, the guests required a
lot from us, and at the end of it we left with a new appreciation of
what we loved to do, and what we can do even better for next year!




If
you can’t make a donation at this time, there are still ways you
can help! Please take a few moments and share our campaign with your
friends and family, via social media, email, and through word of
mouth!

Thank
you in advance for your support and generous donations! Let's
make this real together!

Our
Project in other languages:

                                            
 DEUTSCH  
                 FRANÇAIS 
                 ESPAÑOL  
               РУССКИЙ

story:
It is hard to articulate the growth BuddhiBox has experienced last in the year and a half. What started as me sharing my favorite chemical and cruelty-free products at the yoga studio has morphed into a full-scale business venture ran by a few trusted colleagues that help on small projects and me.

I manifested the idea shortly after I began teaching yoga. Spending more time than ever at the yoga studio, I found myself constantly sharing the products I used and loved. The interactions I had with my students and peers acted as the catalyst for BuddhiBox. 

Once I formulated the idea, it did not take long for me to act. I stepped down from my role as Senior Supply Chain Manager at Red Envelope Gifts and I enrolled in San Diego’s Start Up Leadership program. BuddhiBox was founded in September 2014 on the core tenets of discovery, union and compassion.

I am launching this campaign to ensure our boxes can continue to ship through this period of expansion. The first BuddhiBoxes shipped in November of 2014. The growth and engagement we’ve experienced last year has required changes to the website, changes to our distribution model and a larger volume of units required from vendors. 

BuddhiBox has grown to a size I can no longer manage on my own and I am seeking this funding the facilitate our growth. As an inventory business, I pay deposits to my partner vendors upfront. Ninety-five percent of my partners are small business, it is essential they receive funds to cover the overhead costs. Further, our growth has we required the need for our website capacity to expand. Recently, high traffic caused the website to crash. While I am grateful I have this problem to solve, user experience is suffering as we seek funding to evolve. 

For me, the success of BuddhiBox spans far behind the service itself. Every time a box ships, we help a small business owner earn revenue and gain exposure and proceeds from the box are donated to a nonprofit or charity:

"I was thrilled when BuddhiBox contacted Indo-Love to be featured in one of their monthly boxes! I've been following BuddhiBox since the start. I love everything about BuddhiBox, from their uniquely curated yoga boxes, to their dedication to donating portions of their proceeds back each month to various charities and non profits, to the owner, Maxine, a true inspiration as a female entrepreneur. Maxine seamlessly blends professionalism with a yogi mindset. The perfect combination of a business owner in my eyes!  So far Indo-Love has been featured in two different Buddhiboxes, with hopes for a third in the near future. I look forward to what's to come with this exciting company!!"

-Keeley, Founder, Indo-Love 

"My company House of Good JuJu has had the opportunity to be in a couple of the monthly subscription boxes called Buddhibox. Maxine is a dream to work with! She is very professional and easy to communicate with. We were easily able to collaborate on an item for an upcoming box. She pays my invoice promptly and does wonderful advertising on my product in the upcoming box. We often do giveaways throughout the year on Social Media like Instagram. I am honored to be one of her vendors. She has a wonderful work ethic and his a deeply caring person about people, animals, and the environment."

Jimmie Koenig, Founder, House of Good JuJu

"Maxine has been a great partner to collaborate with. She is supportive of small businesses and helped to increase my brand visibility to like minded yogis out there. I'm proud to be a supporter of BuddhiBox, both as a fellow female entrepreneur and aligning with a brand/company that follows the ethics and principles of yoga."

-Stacey Orr, Founder, Stinky Yogi

As a small business, who you know has a lot to do with your success. Word of mouth and hands-on advertising are invaluable. Working with BuddhiBox, and Maxine specifically, has been very beneficial for my small business. I find that Maxine is easy to talk to and always happy to answer questions. She is very professional in all interactions and honest. I have been with BuddhiBox since the beginning and intend on continuing my partnership inevitably.

Jerra, Founder, Bear's Beauty

I've had the pleasure of working with Maxine and BuddhiBox twice now!  Maxine chose my unique lemon and rosemary Sanitizer Spray in one of her boxes last year and helped support the growth of my product line:  Quinntessentials.  This year she used my Organic Heart of Gold Roll-On Anointing Oil in her February box and I was able to scale up the production of my business because of her high volume order. 

It was a pleasure and honor to work with her because her business model is one that supports small, often local, businesses.  While she grows we all grow.  The general public is so lucky to be provided with all these awesome, organic, vegan-friendly, and rare finds at an affordable price considering the value that each monthly box is really worth.  

What a great concept!  

Maxine has a big heart for people and animals and she takes a lot of care in deciding what businesses to support so she can maintain her core values.  Happy to be a part of her vision!! 

Julie Quinn, Owner, Quinntessentials 

In addition to the strong partnerships BuddhiBox has with our vendors, the subscribers receive a lot more than product with their subscription:

I just wanted to send a quick note to let you know how much I always love my BuddhiBox! Every month the content get absorbed into my life with such ease that I forget how I lived without them. Thank you for the wonderful job you do curating the box each month. 

Sunshine, BuddhiBox Subscriber

BuddhiBox- Thank you SO much for this month's box! I'm going through a rough period right now and everything in this box is actually what I need, especially the turquoise necklace and tea light. I'm always excited every month to come home and find a box full go goodies waiting for me but this box makes me really appreciate the goodness that you're doing for subscribers and the world at large. So thank you for helping me. Namaste. 

Lindsay, BuddhiBox Subscriber

Hi there!

How your Buddhiboxes always seem to arrive in the middle of my most stressful weeks and put such a huge smile on my face EVERY time, is beyond me.

I just want to say THANK YOU.  I truly love getting such lovely, thoughtful and USEFUL items (and information) every month.  What a lovely, lovely business you have.

Kate, BuddhiBox Subscriber

The money you donate to this campaign will go towards hiring operational support, website and tech developments to elevate user experience and business development. For your generous support and donation, we kindly offer:

  • A BuddhiBox valued at $50 for donations of $25
  • A BuddhiBundle: Tank ($30) + Get Buddhi on Mat Magnet ($8), Mat spray ($12), + Yoga Towel ($10) for donations of $50 
  • Three Months Subscription for donations of $110 
  • One Year Subscription (valued at $400+)+ A Jewelry Box (valued at $100) for donations of $500

story:
I'm Karl Young, founder and owner of Hermetic Botanicals LLC. After a life-changing electroshock injury to my left eyebrow on a 440v service powerline, I was left with very little functionality, much aggression, depression and a limited ability to communicate. On my road to recovery, after being told I would be a functional retarded invalid for my lifetime, I discovered an amazing series of plant-based compounds that help with reconnecting the mind and body. As I began to heal, I began developing this plant-based nootropic that I blended with a gummy delivery, that has been found to be unmatched in delivery. As I've continued developing this, my clients have had amazing results(that a number of testimonies and blog posts confirm)  which has led me to this point, where I would like to release this nationally with the proper branding. 


Hermetic Botanicals is a small nutraceutical and nootropics supplement manufacturer based in Portland, Oregon. I've been developing a line of nutraceutical products for a number of years now and am almost ready to release one of the most unique, innovative and effective nootropic supplements to date. 
I've taken a few plant-based compounds (tyrosine, choline, enzymes, etc) and paired them with the amazing nootropic blend of Magnesium L-Threonate (the only form of magnesium to cross the blood brain barrier), Cognizin Citicoline and L-Glutamine, to deliver a tasty, potent gummy that not only is effective by itself, but also improves the effects of other nootropics stacked with it. This is the only product of its kind to be on the market and possesses a design that hits many demographics appeal. 
What we are looking for is the monetary resources to upgrade our packaging from the current bags they're in, to bottles with more shelf appeal and a label fitting such an amazing product. It would include finances for additional marketing through written as well as digital media outlets.

story:
Mission:

PB&Jams, Philadelphia’s nut butter company, is committed to providing a delicious, healthful and fun food experience to our customers. PB&Jams works to give back to our community through education, advocacy, and increased access to both nutrition and opportunity. 

**

Our motto is feed people, help people, and have fun!: in addition to selling our small-batch, all-natural nut butters, sandwiches and snacks, PB&Jams has from day one done everything we can to help our community. From taking our food cart out and providing free meals to the homeless, to donating hundreds of jars of our nut butters to food banks and providing health education to urban families, we at PB&Jams love our community and are committed to its health and vitality.

PB&Jams was honored to be featured in the March 2016 issue of Money Magazine – one of the top 50 magazines in the U.S. – for turning our passion for unique food into successful small business.

Core Values:

·  Food and relationships are necessary for a healthy and vibrant community, and all people deserve to live in healthy and vibrant communities.

·  All people deserve equal and easy access to healthful and sustainable foods.

·  When people have access to healthy foods as the building blocks of their diet, they are free to also make food fun! While PB&Jams is committed to promoting a healthy lifestyle, we recognize, celebrate and create delicious indulgences too, all of which incorporate our healthy nut butters.

·  We recognize that communities of color, working class communities and other marginalized groups continue to have limited access to healthy foods. PB&Jams is committed to fighting this trend through our programming and philanthropic goals.

·  PB&Jams is committed to meaningful diversity, equity, and universal human rights – and these principles guide our internal operations, business practices and community engagement.

WHO WE ARE:

Megan Gibson founded PB&Jams in 2013, after a taste of savory Haitian peanut butter inspired her to start crafting some delicious combinations using nut butter and innovative additions – from sweet maple syrup to spicy cayenne pepper. Soon, her handcrafted, small-batch nut butters could be found in some of Philadelphia’s premier independent markets and at community events.

As the nut butters increased in popularity, Megan’s long-term dream of making fun, delicious food for the community grew, and she developed a plan to establish a food truck using her nut butters in unexpected (and unforgettable!) ways. A custom food truck, unlike any other on the road, was built by hand and hit local events in 2014.

PB&Jams currently operates out of our headquarters – Megan’s home – and a community commercial kitchen in West Philadelphia. The nut butters are still handcrafted in small batches by Megan and her dedicated, creative and wonderful part-time staffer, Mal.

PB&Jams is grateful for our success – defined first and foremost by the remarkable and lasting relationships it has with so many members of the community.

OUR ASK:

In 2016, PB&Jams is ready to take it to the next level! We have always wanted to increase our reach in the community through our food and community initiatives, including nutrition education and programming to support youth and families.

Through this campaign, PB&Jams seeks to raise the funds needed to take our vision to the next level!

Our goals include:

·  Streamlining the production process for our small-batch, unique nut butters by repairing old equipment and securing some new equipment to make the process of making and jarring product more efficient without compromising attention to detail! By upgrading our equipment, we can make your food experience even better and meet increased demand.

·  Covering the costs of a massive repair to our cart, whose frame was found to be defective this past winter. The cart is how we bring our innovative, exciting food into the community.

·  Improving and maximizing our online presence to better engage our community, customers and potential customers. We need a new website!

·  Exploring shifts to our business model which would allow us to help more people in the community. For example, this may include engaging consultants and other professionals who can help us formalize the charitable arm of our work in a new and more effective way.

We need to raise $35,000. Our priority goals include:

$5,000 to repair the machine we use to make our nut butters

$4,000-$5,000 a pneumatic filler: a semi-automated filler to jar our products. This would be a game-changer! Currently, each jar of PB&Jams is filled by spatula, by hand. With the filler, each jar will still receive personal attention – but will be filled more quickly and with great precision.

$4,500 to go toward upgrading our website 

$4,000 to buy our OWN generator. We use a generator to power our cart, and we currently rent it every time we have an event. Having our own generator will save us money and loads of staff time transporting a heavy generator back and forth.

$3,500 for repairs to our cart

$2,000 to redesign and produce a new label including the nutrition facts for our nut butters. Including the nutrition facts on our labels will allow us to sell our product in a wider range of stores.

$1,000 for a higher capacity fryer: the secret to our most decadent sandwich is how we fry it – and now, we can only make a sandwich at a time. A new fryer means both faster service and greater capacity. We could pursue bigger events and produce faster at smaller ones.

$1,000 a new iPad and square register system to improve the sales process, bookkeeping system and the ability to accept gift cards.

(Note: IndieGoGo does charge us a percentage of the money we raise; so we will also put funds toward covering those fees. Other costs - like those associated with hiring professionals to help us evaluate our business model and perhaps make changes - are to be determined.)

story:
We are Strange Cargo Arts Company and we have been running the Charivari Day Carnival for the past 20 years.

11,000 people have worked with us and taken part in Charivari from the surrounding area from the last 20 years - and the children from the first parade are now the parents from the next generation of carnival participants, which we think is a major achievment. Charivari Day will be taking over the streets of Folkestone on the 9th July and to prepare for this we will be making hundreds of wonderful costumes with people from the community, and from the Schools throughout the area, to get ready for the day. The young people who join in have the chance to work in a professional creative environment, with specialised carnival artists, then celebrate what they have learnt by showing off their amazing carnival costumes on the day.

Funding is harder to find than ever, so we are asking you to help us make this extraordinary day of community celebration, spectacle and music happen by supporting our campaign. If everyone who has joined in over the years can make a small contribution it would be brilliant.

We promise to deliver an amazing event and with your support we will be able to do this.

This is a free event for the community, anyone can be involved and many thousands of people come out to be a part of this colourful day.

Thank you.

Charivari Day will be taking over the streets of Folkestone on the 9th July and to prepare for this we will be making hundreds of wonderful costumes with people from the community, and from the Schools throughout the area, to get ready for the day. story:
As of the 15th June 2016, The TEAPOT PROJECT CIC 9761608 is officially homeless.
In an ironic twist, and after McGinty's develop new plans to open their own food establishment with a pub menu in time for the EUFA Cup, The Teapot Project (TTP) has been made homeless with notice to leave in just three weeks time. In a bid to protect the hard work of some fourteen or more volunteers in their current crisis, TTP ask for help to kick start their plans to bounce back into action and ensure that the high levels of food intercepted is not yet again found in skips heading to local landfill, and that the vulnerably housed tea drinkers of Ipswich, many of whom, not only rely on TTP's daily meals, but rely on the extended support and care for their needs, are still fed and have a safe and welcoming location to continue to thrive as they overcome such challenging adversity.
"With 130,000 people living in Ipswich alone and 700,000 in Suffolk, we hope with just a small donation from the portion who are able to, we might stand a chance at raising funds to buy a suitable replacement for our unique and valued award winning café"
TTP call out for community support in order to buy a suitable property to continue their work, and urge those that can, to make a donation. Each day TTP provides food on a pay as you feel basis, making food accessible to all, without prejudice, so true to form, the plea comes with the same Pay as you Feel mentality; what you feel you can afford, and what you feel TTP is worth. Here's some of what TTP means to those that already know them:
"Helping out The Teapot Project has been one of the best things I have ever done and has restored my faith in humanity"
"What has the teapot meant to me? A place to be myself where I am accepted without question or comment"
Some of the students said, "the teapot has changed how we feel for people who don't have a home and we have learnt that there are plenty of ways to people's hearts, and our cooking is the best way!"
"Without the teapot and the family it has brought to me, I can't say for certain I'd still be standing with you today"
"The teapot means a lot. It helps massively to myself and others who can't make ends meet"
"Brilliant project that aims to reduce food waste, very affordable, and a comfortable environment with friendly staff where you're always greeted with a big smile :-)"
"The Teapot project is a paragon of virtue, welcoming people from all walks of life and creating a place where I, and many others, feel at home"
Mischa Pearson, café owner and founder of TTP also added "I can't thank our volunteers, college students, tea drinkers and faithful customers enough for their unreserved support over the past seven months we've been open and I assure those involved in our continued success that we will not be giving up; This is merely a new beginning".

story:
CHI SIAMO

Siamo un gruppo Scout di 26 ragazzi e ragazze tra i 16 e i 21 anni di Castel Goffredo, in provincia di Mantova.

COSA VOGLIAMO

Vogliamo realizzare il nostro progetto di andare a Zumbahua, piccolo paesino sulle Ande dell’Ecuador, per supportare la comunità locale nella costruzione di alcune case.

PERCHÈ

Il progetto nasce da mesi di discussioni all’interno del nostro Clan: cosa possiamo fare per riuscire allo stesso tempo a metterci in gioco personalmente e capire più a fondo ciò che succede intorno a noi? Come possiamo imparare, lungo il cammino, a trasformare in realtà anche i sogni più audaci e impensabili? Come possiamo agire impegnando innanzitutto noi stessi fino ad avere un impatto nelle cose lontane?

Cercavamo un sogno in grado di contenere tutto questo, e quindi abbiamo scelto un obiettivo che fosse grande e difficile da realizzare.

Trasformare questo sogno in realtà ha significato imparare a progettare e iniziare un cammino di preparazione un anno prima della nostra partenza. Ha significato anche affrontare tante difficoltà, impegnarsi a fondo per riuscire a rendere questo sogno un progetto concreto.

L’obiettivo è diventato quindi effettuare un’esperienza di servizio dall’altra parte del mondo, in Ecuador, accompagnando tutto il percorso con un approfondimento teorico sul diritto all’umanità.

L’Ecuador è considerato un paese in via di sviluppo, dove la povertà diffusa raggiunge apici impensabili nelle comunità montane. Proprio in una di queste comunità si concentrerà il nostro operato.

COSA ABBIAMO GIÀ FATTO

Questo viaggio non nasce oggi, ma molti mesi fa. Crediamo che l’unico modo per realizzare un obiettivo sia quello di impegnarsi in prima persona. Per questo motivo negli ultimi 10 mesi siamo stati impegnati in diverse modalità di raccolta fondi:

  • attività di autofinanziamento (bancarelle di oggetti realizzati da noi, servizi a degli eventi, baby sitting, feste di compleanno, ecc..)

  • risparmio personale di 50€ mensili (essendo quasi tutti studenti tale somma non poteva che essere ricavata da alcune rinunce nella propria vita) in modo da dare ancora maggior valore al servizio che faremo

  • donazioni individuali e raccolta fondi sul territorio

  • campagna di crowdfunding sul web

Il risparmio personale e le attività di autofinanziamento hanno lo scopo di renderci i primi attori del progetto. Il nostro impegno è fondamentale per chiedere alle altre persone di credere nel progetto e sostenerci.

IL PROGETTO

Il progetto prende forma dopo l’incontro con Don Claudio, missionario dell’operazione Mato Grosso, il quale ci propone di aiutarli nella realizzazione di alcune case nel paesino di Zumbahua (Ecuador).

Uno dei problemi maggiori a Zumbahua è la mancanza di case dignitose e resistenti. Quasi tutti vivono in capanne di mattoni di fango e paglia e lamiera, che vengono spesso distrutte e divelte dalla pioggia e dal forte vento estivo.

Il lavoro che possiamo svolgere è proprio la costruzione di due case più resistenti: le strade dissestate e i mancati collegamenti rendono questo lavoro molto lungo (i muratori locali sono solo due) e uno dei problemi principali è il trasporto dei materiali da cantiere.

Con la mano d’opera, giovane ed entusiasta, di 26 ragazzi sarebbe infatti possibile costruire due case durante la nostra permanenza (20 giorni); il numero elevato permette infatti il veloce trasporto dei materiali (principalmente a piedi) e un aiuto sostanziale nelle più facili operazioni edilizie.

Dunque il cuore del progetto sarà la realizzazione delle abitazioni, ma durante la nostra permanenza saremo impegnati anche in altre attività formative:

  • Un gemellaggio con un gruppo scout di Quito

  • Attività ricreative con i bambini di Zumbahua

  • Piccole escursioni sulle Ande

COME POTETE AIUTARCI

Qualsiasi  aiuto economico è benvenuto! Per raggiungere i soldi necessari dobbiamo arrivare a 3000 euro, e se decidi di donare anche solo 3 o 4 euro ci permetti di avvicinarci all'obiettivo.
Se però puoi o vuoi dare un contributo più consistente, tanto meglio! Per chi decide di darci di più sono prevsite anche le ricompense che trovate a destra.
Se la tua azienda ha intenzione di diventare sponsor ufficiale del nostro progetto, prendi contatto con noi a questa mail: clan.castelgoffredo1@gmail.com

IL BUDGET

Il budget necessario per realizzazione l’intero progetto è pari a circa 33.200€.

Raggiungeremo questa cifra attraverso 5 modalità di finanziamento:

  • i genitori dei 26 ragazzi hanno messo 250€ ciascuno per un totale di 6.500€

  • i ragazzi hanno deciso di attivarsi in un risparmio personale mensile di 50 € da Novembre 2015 fino a luglio 2016 per un totale di 11.700 €

  • L’attività di autofinanziamento ad oggi ha fruttato 5.000€ con l’obiettivo finale dopo le ultime attività estive di 7.000€

  • Sono fino ad ora arrivate donazioni pari a 5.000 €

  • Campagna di crowdfunding 3.000 €

COSA ABBIAMO IMPARATO FINO AD ORA

Qui un riassunto degli argomenti e degli obiettivi emersi durante gli incontri degli ultimi anni, che sono diventati parte del nostro progetto:

  • capacità di guardare al futuro con atteggiamento di fiducia, apertura e dialogo;

  • pensare in grande;

  • in una realtà “istantanea”, fatta  di gratificazioni immediate, occorre sviluppare la capacità di progettare a lungo termine;

  • prendersi la responsabilità di un impegno duraturo nel tempo;

  • pianificare obiettivi, azioni, risorse per compiere un progetto;

  • guardare le cose da un’altra prospettiva per essere più consapevoli;

  • disponibilità e apertura al cambiamento.

story:
Lâche Pas Boucherie is from an area of Louisiana referred to as Acadiana, which surrounds our hub city of Lafayette. Due to our separatist history, Cajuns and Creoles of this land have defiantly held on to certain aspects of our culture that have been washed away in other parts of the US. Our language, music and cuisine manages to retain its identity even through the growing pains of progress and evolution. This rings true in our distinct process of butchering livestock, which we refer to as a Boucherie.

Traditionally a Boucherie is a community coming together to harvest an animal. Due to the intensive labor involved in whole animal butchering, a farmer would call upon friends, family and neighbors to assist in the task. This day of work normally turned into a celebration, with plenty of food, music and spirits to go around. No one went home hungry or empty handed. With a lack of refrigeration, this was the only time that fresh meat could be consumed. Most of the meat butchered at a Boucherie was processed with the intent of preservation, with the understanding that not a single aspect of the sacrificed beast would be wasted. These are the core fundamentals of our cuisine.

Basically what we do is travel around the country demonstrating and teaching these traditions. Due to the current lack of personal connection to our food source and the ever growing farm to table movement, this process really speaks volumes to its participants.  Most have never seen the harvesting of an animal that they intend on eating. To say that the experience is impactful would be an understatement. Some have referred to it as spiritual. I would call it natural. There is a primal state of being that is triggered that most members of our species have never accessed. All that attend go home moved to say the least. To do this we recruit help from chefs, butchers and farmers from your area. Over 2 days, the participants are led through the slaughtering, butchering, processing and cooking of the animal, culminating in in a beautiful 6 course meal. This harvest would be in vain without the help of it's community's. We need your financial support. Help us change the way your community eats.

story:
Nestled in the woods outside of Olympia, Washington, a group of friends are creating a space to become increasingly self sufficient as an independent community. We are Tanglemoss Collective and we're hoping to get more people involved in our super rad project.

Objectives (elaboration below)
1. Collectively buy land
2. Live communally
3. Become increasingly self-sufficient
4. Share skills

Here are some ways you can support us and our project:

- Share this info and share our crowdfunding page via social media. Print this out as an info sheet or zine and post it at your local library/info shop/food co-op.
- Come live with us! We are five adult humans and a handful of non-human animals. We want to share this dream with a whole community of folks. If you’re interested in joining us, we’d love to hear from you.
- Contribute financially. If you’re not interested or able to join us right now, but want to support the cause, contributions to our Indiegogo or PayPal are greatly appreciated. 
- Advice! Know anything about real estate, soil, promoting, recruiting, off-grid living, legal stuff for collectivizing, potentially becoming a non-profit or any other advice you think would be helpful? Contact us, we'd love to talk.
- Buy eggs! If you're local, you can help support us by buying organic, free- range eggs from us.

More on our objectives...

1st Objective:
Collectively buy land.
This property must meet the needs of the current participants, have long term sustainability (water, farming acres, etc) for our goals of becoming increasingly self-sufficient, allow plenty of living space for future community members to build dwellings, and potentially allow space for visitors, educational work trade, skillshare camp outs, and who knows what.

We currently have secured financing and are looking at properties. As most properties are not set up to accommodate pet goats or more than a “single family”, we anticipate initial financial burdens that greatly exceed the monthly mortgage. We are trying to make a space for a larger community using the means of just a handful of current members, so to help alleviate some of the financial burden on the founding members, we are also pursuing crowdfunding.

2nd Objective:
Live communally.
Living communally reduces our need for manufacturing, transportation of goods and dependence on capitalism, and replaces that with the mutual aid provided by friends who trust and support each other. The community we are creating will be non-hierarchical. All decisions will be made by consensus.

3rd Objective:
Become increasingly self-sufficient.
Over time we want to make the property able to sustain its inhabitants without the need of outside resources. We will have electricity, plumbing, and all those luxuries, but we want to work towards not needing them, or being able to go without them indefinitely if we wanted or needed to. The climate in our area is projected to have heavier rain in the winter and drier summers, so we will build rain catching systems to help reduce the draw from our water well in the summer. We will of course grow our own produce, forest farm in our wooded areas, then over time start taking on more projects and mastering new skills. Some examples include growing our own wheat for flour, herbs for medicine, making oils and vinegars, building a stove out of bricks made from our soil, and spinning fibers.

4th Objective:
Share skills.
Humans are basically something of a terrible plague on the earth. Humans who lived here before us lived (and in some places continue to live) harmoniously with nature. We're hoping, with some expected trial and error, that it is still possible for us to live sustainably, without the need to import goods and resources. That's where we're hoping to get at some point. With this property, we aim to foster each others' efforts to decivilize and relearn skills for living which do not contribute to the destruction of the earth.

Thanks for reading!
We hope that you'll get involved or help us get the word out to folks who might want to get involved by donating and sharing!

https://www.paypal.me/tanglemosscollective
http://tanglemosscollective.tumblr.com/
https://www.facebook.com/Tanglemosscollective/
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/tanglemoss-homesteading-community/

properties. As most properties are not set up to accommodate pet goats 
or more than a “single family”, we anticipate initial financial burdens 
that greatly exceed the monthly mortgage. We are trying to make a space 
for a larger community using the means of just a handful of current 
members, so to help alleviate some of the financial burden on the 
founding members, we are also pursuing crowdfunding.  2nd Objective: Live communally. 
 Living communally reduces our need for manufacturing, transportation of
 goods and  dependence on capitalism, and replaces that with the mutual 
aid provided by friends who trust and support each other. The community 
we are creating will be non-hierarchical. All decisions will be made by 
consensus.   3rd Objective: Become increasingly self-sufficient. 
 Over time we want to make the property able to sustain its inhabitants 
without the need of outside resources. We will have electricity, 
plumbing, and all those luxuries, but we want to work towards not needing
 them, or being able to go without them indefinitely if we wanted or 
needed to. The climate in our area is projected to have heavier rain in 
the winter and drier summers, so we will build rain catching systems to 
help reduce the draw from our water well in the summer. We will of 
course grow our own produce, forest farm in our wooded areas, then over 
time start taking on more projects and mastering new skills. Some 
examples include growing our own wheat for flour, herbs for medicine, 
making oils and vinegars, building a stove out of bricks made 
from our soil, and spinning fibers.  4th Objective: Share skills.
 Humans are basically something of a terrible plague on the earth. Humans who lived 
here before us lived (and in some places continue to live) harmoniously 
with nature. We're hoping, with some expected trial and error, that it is
 still possible for us to live sustainably, without the need to import goods 
and resources. That's where we're hoping to get at some point. With this property, we aim to foster each others' efforts to decivilize 
and relearn skills for living which do not contribute to the destruction
 of the earth.
 Thanks for reading! We hope that you'll get involved or help us get the word out to folks who might want to get involved by donating and sharing!https://www.paypal.me/tanglemosscollectivehttp://tanglemosscollective.tumblr.com/https://www.facebook.com/Tanglemosscollective/https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/tanglemoss-homesteading-community/

story:
Video de présentation, cliquez ici


Salukes ! 

Bière Dikkenek est un projet qui mûrit depuis 4 ans dans la tête de Dave. Le projet est animé d'une envie de partager des bons moments autour d'une bière spéciale, mais également revendiquer que l'on aime ça. Consommer la bière et adhérer au projet Dikkenek, c'est une façon de s'inscrire dans un esprit " à la belge" avec tout ce qu'on lui connait :  humour, bon goût, bonne compagnie, autodérision, compromis et surréalisme. Dikkenek, ce terme est compris par un flamand, wallon, bruxellois, français. C'est aussi un petit clin d'oeil au film qui est sorti le 21 juin 2006 et à son humour bien belge et "décalé". 

La bière est brassée en périphérie bruxelloise à la Belgoo Brewery, elle est blonde et titre à 6,7 % Vol. Alc. Elle bénéficie d'une franche amertume persistante avec une subtile note florale et une fine saveur mandarine, c'est clairement une bière de soif. Elle est le fruit d'une collaboration entre Jo Van Aert, brasseur/propriétaire et David Blocteur, consultant indépendant pour micro brasseries et actif dans le milieu brassicole depuis plus de 10 ans. La recette a été élaborée à la base par David Blocteur lors de sessions de brassages "en amateur" pour ensuite être finalisée par JO Van Aert.

Cet esprit, David B (gembloutois d'origine), l'a développé lors de ses années d'études supérieures à Bruxelles. Institut Coremans, EPFC et surtout au cercle Hermes lors de guindailles estudiantines dans les divers cercles de l'ULB et des sorties dans les marolles. 

Le projet a besoin de vous ! 

Crowdfunding = financement participatif. ici, nous sommes dans le cadre d'un financement participatif avec contreparties.

Cela signifie que pour une somme investie, vous contribuez à l'expansion du projet. En échange vous recevez des goodies à hauteur de l'investissement, mais vous devenez également membre d'une communauté. Vous serez invités chaque année à participer à une soirée Dikkenek. Ce sera l'occasion d'échanger les avis, déguster en priorité un nouveau brassin. La communauté aura toujours un privilège de priorité sur l'information, sur les nouveautés.

Dans le cadre de ce crowdfunding, votre aide est précieuse pour investir dans l'achat de matériels utiles à la bonne distribution de la bière. Dans un premier temps, il est nécessaire d'investir dans des fûts en inox (300 pièces) et dans des casiers en plastique (2000 pièces).

Le premier brassage a eu lieu le 9 mars. Il y a 24 hectolitres de bière blonde prête à être mise en fût et en bouteille.

Un deuxième brassage a eu lieu ce vendredi 13 mai afin d'assurer la continuité de la distribution à partir de son lancement le 3 juin prochain. 

Lors de sa sortie, une liste des endroits où vous pourrez la déguster et l'acheter sera publiée. (Envoyée par mail et/ou publiée sur la page Facebook)

Les ingrédients : 4 malts ; Pilsen, Pale Ale, Munich, Malt de blé et 3 houblons : Hallertau Perle, Chinook et Cascade.

Ce que vous recevrez en contrepartie de votre contribution ? 

Cela va du stickers au verre, en passant par un décapsuleur personnalisé, un t-shirt, une casquette, le droit de participer au brassage de la bière, des fûts offerts pour fêter un anniversaire ou organiser un barbecue, .... Bref, il y a vraiment de quoi se faire plaisir.

Sans oublier, l'invitation à participer le 3 juin 2016 à partir de 19h au lancement de la bière dans un établissement sélectionné pour son esprit "Dikkenek" 

Si vous n'êtes pas disponibles ce jour là, pas de panique il y aura d'autres occasions de se rattraper. Votre package, vous sera remis dans les semaines qui suivent.

Chaque année, il y aura une Dikkenek Party à laquelle tous les crowdfunders seront conviés. 

Pas de compte Paypal ou de carte Visa ? 

Aucun problème, un compte bancaire est spécialement ouvert pour y transférer votre participation financière. Le montant sera automatiquement prit en compte sur la page de indiegogo/Dikkenek crowdfunding. Vous pourrez,ainsi, y suivre l'évolution. Demande de ce numéro via le petit lien "poser une question" en surbrillance rose en haut à droite de la page,

 juste au dessus de la mention " Montant recueilli"

Mille fois merci :)

Dave

Votre package, vous sera remis dans les semaines qui suivent.Chaque année, il y aura une Dikkenek Party à laquelle tous les crowdfunders seront conviés. Pas de compte Paypal ou de carte Visa ? Aucun problème, un compte bancaire est spécialement ouvert pour y transférer votre participation financière. story:
What?

A modern hostel & boutique hotel

 

Where?

 

The Village of West Greenville (Greenville, SC Arts District)

 

Why?

 

To create an inviting and safe space for all people to experience Greenville  

Why a hostel?

Caleb and I asked ourselves a year and a half ago, "What if there was a place where you could stay overnight that instantly plugged you into a city's creative culture and community?" We believe we've found the answer - and now we're finally going public and sharing with you all of the faces behind this incredible new venture as we make our dream a reality. 

As a unique concept and rare combination of boutique hotel and hostel-style rooms, Modal offers a completely different hospitality service. In contrast to traditional hotels & motels, bed & breakfasts and AirBnB, Modal will become the capstone culture and communal experience for travelers venturing to Greenville, SC. With local food, artwork, music and communal events, Modal is for you and me, becoming more, together.

We're proud of our city and believe you are too! Let's join forces together to keep Greenville a Top 10 destination city to visit, live and work. Learn how you can pledge and support below.

Where is my money going?

We have a 6000+ sq foot property in The Village of West Greenville under contract; however we need significant funding support to place a down payment on the building, renovate and then open our doors in 2017. Our campaign goal is $55K. Large or little, we will use the funding from this campaign to make Modal a reality. Every dollar you contribute will go to these efforts.

BUDGET AND LENDING BREAKDOWN

 

 

Why support local?

In true Modal style, we have partnered with some of the best and most talented creatives in Greenville to bring you incredible incentives and gifts. With handmade bracelets from Maritime Supply, limited edition art prints by Emily Jeffords and exclusive room vouchers to stay at Modal, we're confident you'll find something just right for you.

What do I get if I pledge?

Besides the thrill of being part of an incredible project, there are several great incentives for pledging! Below are pictorial references for the incentives listed to the right. We're thrilled by the incredible talent located right in the heart of The Village of West Greenville and across our town. Get these limited edition goodies before they're gone!

 

 

 

 

 

 

Why The Village?

 

The Village of West Greenville continues to attract artists, small businesses, creatives, makers and entrepreneurs due to its simple culture and community values. With new restaurants, shops and unique concepts opening rapidly, this growing area of the city will only continue to become a major destination for the Southeast. 
Isn't this risky?

Big dreams take risk, but we're confident we have some of the best people in our city gathered around us and we're all passionately pursuing the same thing; a thriving community that we're proud of.

Although Caleb and I have a combined professional work experience of 13 years in corporate marketing, IT, finance and event logistics, neither of us have owned or managed a hostel. We identified key advisors from the hospitality market and continue to meet with them monthly to ensure we're making the best decisions for Modal. The challenge ignites our passion for Modal that much more. 

What can I do besides pledge?

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help. We've had so many incredible people donate their time and energy already. Here are a few ways you can support:

  • Talk about it! Share with everyone you know across social media. Use the Indiegogo share tools or copy this link and post it as your status on Facebook right now!
  • Follow Us. We're on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter. Hit us up and keep updated with all the latest Modal news.
  • Send us your thoughts and ideas. We want Modal to incorporate as much communal involvement as possible. Your thoughts matter to us! Email us at modalgreenville@gmail.com.

What do the rooms look like?

 

Here are some sneak peek photos of what the rooms will look like and what you can expect to experience when you stay at Modal. Whether you book a bunk or a private room, we're sure you'll fall in love with the casual and clean atmosphere, stellar design features and calming vibe.

Each bunk room will have a vintage locomotive charm along with artistic details and midwestern flair. The rooms will have four twin-sized bunks, so bring your friends!

The private guest rooms are each named after a local artist and showcase the artist's work. Each room can accommodate two guests with a queen size bed. Perfect for a romantic getaway or quiet weekend. 

 

 

Are You Qualified?

For the past year, Caleb and I have been learning the ropes of hospitality by hosting AirBnB guests at a private home in Greenville. We're learning valuable insight into the travel trends and tourist patterns that will ultimately assist in ensuring that Modal provides an ideal experience for our out-of-town guests. 

The time for a hostel in Greenville is now. With our combined experience and an incredible advisory group below, we have no doubt that Modal will be a big hit!

Major Thank You to These Fine Folks

The following individuals deserve a major shout out. We could never have accomplished this campaign or seen Modal come to this point without the following insanely talented people and their constant support:
 
  • DuBose Ratchford - PR & Communications
  • Laura Hinson - PR & Communications
  • Brinson McGowan - Branding
  • MJ Slide - Copy Writing & Video Direction
  • Andrew Bradford - Video Production
  • Corey Wavle - Video Post Production
  • Jayme CG Smoak - AV Tech
  • Barb Blair - Furniture Prop
  • Emily Jeffords - Artwork
  • Joseph Bradley - Artwork
  • Ben Riddle - Talent
  • Cassia & Tony Abbott - Talent
  • Adam Powell - Talent
  • Drew Stanley - Talent
  • Ruta Fox - Media & Talent
  • Johnnie Choi - Talent
  • Charnese Mangle - Talent
  • Nate Mylander - Talent
  • Mark Ratchford - Real Estate
  • Job Childers - Music Score
  • Ruth Hindman DePasquale - Legal
  • Tony DePasquale - Legal
 

FAQs About Modal 

Visit our website and learn about the details of your stay here.

story:
For more great photos of the Sleepy Snoogus, follow us on Instagram.

You can find videos about our producers here. 

Visit our www.cambodiaknits.com for more info! 

Q: Can I contribute without claiming a perk? 
If you want to donate to our campaign without claiming a perk, your entire donation will go directly into our Education Fund. Simply click on the pink "Back It" button at the top of the page, next to our video and follow the instructions. 
Q: What sizes do your hats come in? 
The Sleepy Snoogu hats are available in newborn, 1 year and 2 year sizes. Contact us if you would like a bigger size. 
Q: How big are the Sleep Snoogus?
Each Snoogu is about 35cm tall, not counting the Bunny ears. Sophea the Sleep Bunny is the tallest if you count her ears :)
Q: How is the employment your offer sustainable? 

A: We offer a way for those in poor communities to make a living within their homes by providing paid training, supplying all materials to producers so they don’t have to invest their own money in advance and traveling to the communities regularly to collect finished products and providing on-going training. By allowing producers to work from their own homes, we ensure that they can continue to receive income regardless of external factors such as transport costs or childcare needs. By focusing on creating high quality products, we aim to ensure that this provides a viable profession and source of income for the future.  

Q: Do you provide any other benefits to your producers?

A: Although our producers work on a piece rate and are home-based we provide additional benefits for them such as an emergency medical fund, transportation for health emergencies, annual eye exams and free glasses, performance bonuses and maternity leave. We also give first priority to our home-based producers when full-time positions open at our headquarters and offer training courses in relevant topics such as personal financial management and health and hygiene. And from September, with your help, we will provide scholarships for children of our producers.

Q: Where do you ship? 

A: We ship worldwide! 

Q: What if I want something different?

A: We hope that our new line offers something for everyone. However, if you have any special requests – a product in a different colour or a specific animal for a special person – please contact us and we will see what we can do.

Q: Are your dolls child safe?

A: Safety is important in the making of our dolls, ensuring they are safe for young children. We have made sure to pay close attention to every step of the process, taking into careful consideration our targeted age range. Each doll is handcrafted with 80% cotton/20% milk fiber yarn, securely sewn together and stuffed with 100% new polyester fill
