story:
Who am I?
My name is Alan Lane. B.Sc. (hons) First Computer Science.  My primary interest and skill set is creating bespoke applications that dynamically utilise data for real world solutions. I have a great deal of business experience and have worked with large corporations including Tesco, Elevate Finance, University College London, Cambridge University, Lola Cars and MBDA systems.
 

What's this all about?

Building on my remit to make complex systems transparent and user friendly, I am now concentrating on developing an application concerned with UK Law.

Research into the state of small and medium claims (for £25.000 and less) in UK county courts has revealed that given the high numbers of allocations to court, the number of defences that reach court on time, are heard and have judgements ruled upon is remarkably low. This could reflect a number of factors that are preventing defences; complexity would feature highly as would fear of loss and assumed high costs of bringing a professional defence. Therefore, as the statistics show, most defendants will settle either in court or out, despite the possibility of having valid defences.
Ref: https://www.gov.uk/government/statistics/court-...

These statistics are quantifiable by the numbers of allotted court submissions or litigations. Given that defences are low, so it might also follow that a similar number of valid litigations are also low and for the same reasons, and I believe that an online application could exploit these statistics as a niche.

There exists already an online application to litigate, this is popular but is complex to use and invites litigators and defendants to complete to allocation and defence without the aid of professional assistance and where this assistance may be considered to be not worth the outlay. I propose to present Legal Arbitration as an alternative and have an online solution in development that would negate the barriers to consideration of a legal route in settlement for personal or business disagreements. This solution can be outlined on application from serious enquiries.

This application seeks to;

  • To steer claimants away from Litigation toward Arbitration by showing that the cost in funds and time can be avoided by fair and sensible solutions. The strap line is to be Don’t Litigate, Ebitrate!!©
  • To produce a simple and universally understandable vehicle to settle disputes in the shortest time frame possible.
  • To gain the trust of any party involved in a dispute, in order to expand client base (for legal firms) or, should Arbitration fail, leading to a case going to court (as a last resort).
  • To gather a transcript of an arbitration history for submission to a court should that arbitration fail due to the reluctance of any party to proceed after a fair appraisal and decision has been offered.
  • To make claimant and respondent fully aware that this transcript will be submitted to court as evidence of failed arbitration, therefore levering the case for a successful arbitration.
  • To make claimant and respondent fully aware that the results of any case that went to court would subsequently be exposed through the ebitration.com web site.
  • To filter out and therefore dissuade spurious claims or defences.
  • To expose through listings on the site frequent or stubborn claimants or respondents.
  • To raise the profile of participating Law firms as positive and forward thinking.
  • To exploit revenues that would otherwise be lost from potential claimants or respondents who, when faced with the complexity of the legal system, or who may be dissuaded by the fear of loss and extra expense, fail to escalate or defend their case.
  • To become as popular as www.moneyclaim.gov.uk .
  • To significantly reduce small claims in the UK and to produce a workable blueprint that can be expanded to include larger claims, both nationally and internationally.
  • To level the playing field and make law accessible to all that need it, even against large businesses or long standing disputes.
  • And to significantly reduce the carbon footprint of the present court service system by truncating the need for large heated venues and the presence of personnel associated with the running of the system on any particular day.

What will the donation be used for?

Your contribution would help to enable access to Law to a much wider demographic through Legal Arbitration, when adopted as the norm ‘Ebitration©’ will become a household word that would stand for transparency and fairness in legal disputes, there would be no more threat of huge legal bills for relatively small gains and contributors would have shown that massive changes can be achieved by caring people.

The funding I seek to raise is to aid in the costs of the application development. If part or fully raised, the support would be vital in as much as I would have sufficient time and funds to conduct research, finalise design principles and begin construction of this solution to a test bed stage, after which I would then seek government grants to move forward to advertise and launch. I will of course keep maticulous accounts which will always be available for viewing to every contributor.

There are many ways that you can get involved in this project and all contribution will be very gratefully received. Any amount is welcome but if you can’t donate at this time, please spread the word. All contributors will be listed (unless wishing to remain anonymous) on the Ebitrate© Role of honour which will eventually be highlighted on the finished web site ebitrate.com and will receive personal email updates from me.

Thank you for reading this pitch, if you have any questions or concerns or simply just want to learn more about this project, please don't hesitate to contact me and I will send you my research and outlines to date.
story_txt:
Who am I?My name is Alan Lane. B.Sc. (hons) First Computer Science.  My primary interest and skill set is creating bespoke applications that dynamically utilise data for real world solutions. I have a great deal of business experience and have worked with large corporations including Tesco, Elevate Finance, University College London, Cambridge University, Lola Cars and MBDA systems. What's this all about?Building on my remit to make complex systems transparent and user friendly, I am now concentrating on developing an application concerned with UK Law.Research into the state of small and medium claims (for £25.000 and less) in UK county courts has revealed that given the high numbers of allocations to court, the number of defences that reach court on time, are heard and have judgements ruled upon is remarkably low. This could reflect a number of factors that are preventing defences; complexity would feature highly as would fear of loss and assumed high costs of bringing a professional defence. Therefore, as the statistics show, most defendants will settle either in court or out, despite the possibility of having valid defences.Ref: https://www.gov.uk/government/statistics/court-...These statistics are quantifiable by the numbers of allotted court submissions or litigations. Given that defences are low, so it might also follow that a similar number of valid litigations are also low and for the same reasons, and I believe that an online application could exploit these statistics as a niche.There exists already an online application to litigate, this is popular but is complex to use and invites litigators and defendants to complete to allocation and defence without the aid of professional assistance and where this assistance may be considered to be not worth the outlay. I propose to present Legal Arbitration as an alternative and have an online solution in development that would negate the barriers to consideration of a legal route in settlement for personal or business disagreements. story:
Do you enjoy a good book on a rainy day? Or sitting by the fire on a cold day with a good book? Or sitting on the beach with a good book? Basically, do you like books? We do too. That's why we want to start a bookstore downtown Grand Rapids.

Last April, I went to an independent bookstore out in Kalamazoo with some friends. What was supposed to take half an hour browsing for new books, turned into 2 hours. I miss being able to do that downtown Grand Rapids. Unlike the last downtown bookstore, Page Turners won't be just a 5-year experiment. Page Turners will be a staple in this ever growing city. Being surrounded by books makes me feel both excited and at home.

This is where you come in. Starting a bookstore from scratch costs a bit of money and we are not a millionaires, so we're going to need your help! The good news though is it'll only take roughly 3% of the Grand Rapids population contributing $5 to make this bookstore happen. 

Page Turners will be a place where people are welcomed to come in and browse. Maybe discover something new or check out some of the local artist's work displayed for sale on the wall. Self-published authors will be encouraged to sell their books here. Page Turners will become part of Grand Rapids. A place where the local books nerds can call home.

Teachers, administrators, and librarians will enjoy a certain % off all orders. It is our goal to support local schools in Grand Rapids and the people that work for them. We're asking Grand Rapids to buy local, so we want to support local in any way we can. 

You can help spread the word on this bookstore by liking and sharing on facebook and following the store on twitter.

story:
My name is Tami C. I am the owner of IMENA Inc. We are a beauty company based in NYC. For the past 4 years we have built a salon business in Harlem, NY. We have a unique system of salon membership that our clients and stylists really enjoy. Clients pay one price and get all of their hair care needs taken care of. There are several things that make us different from other beauty salons:

  • Clients are seen when they arrive. We have an excellent track record of honoring the time of our client members.
  • Clients get different types of styles with one membership. this allows them to be versatile without having to worry about price.
  • We work together with stylists to teach techniques on how to care for all types of hair from curly, coily to straight.
  • Stylists get paid on time and enjoy having control and flexibility over their schedules and the clients they accept.
  • Our client members can come to our location in Harlem or get service at one of our partner salon locations in New Jersey, Bronx and South Harlem.
  • Clients get discounts on products and events given by IMENA.
  • Stylists get ongoing education and training. We host most of these trainings at our salon location in Harlem.

This is a new and innovative way for clients to get hair and beauty services and for professionals to do business in this industry. And we are very happy to provide this service to the public through our IMENA membership.

From the beginning when we first opened our location, one of the things we have struggled with is marketing and promotion. In order to grow we need more people to learn about us, and join our IMENA membership. Paying rent on our salon space every month eats up a large portion of our income on a monthly basis.  In order for us to continue in our salon space in Harlem we are looking to raise enough money to pay off the rent for the time remaining on the lease (12 months) so we can focus our income on strategies (marketing and promotion) to grow the business. We are asking you to please make a donation in any amount to help use reach this goal so we can stay in our salon space in Harlem.

Prior to owning this business I was a social worker. I have always had a large part of my heart and my purpose rooted in doing things that benefit community. I believe our salon space in Harlem does just that. It allows people (mostly women) to have a safe space to express their hair needs, to learn about the beauty of themselves, and to feel supported in their hair and beauty journeys. Also, a portion of the proceeds from our salon goes to support charitable organizations. So when you help us you help your community as well.

I believe we are doing great work. But we need more people to know about us. We can only accomplish that through marketing. If we pay off our lease we will have the ability to expand and be successful. We will be able to advertise, vend and sponsor more events like CIRCLE OF SISTERS, CURL FEST and AFRO PUNK, which are some of the popular events in NYC. We will be able to market on popular websites and blogs like www.IDONTDOCLUBS.com to promote our membership.  So please support us in our campaign so we can continue to do the work in the community we love.

Here's what we need: $35,000 to pay off the remaining balance of our lease.

Why? Because we need to put the revenue earned back into the business to be successful in our current salon space without the burden of rent. If we do not raise the money we will have to close our salon location in Harlem. We want to keep this space so we can continue to serve the Harlem community. Any amount raised will go toward the next steps for the business including possibly finding a new space or continuing the work through virtual means.

I want to sincerely thank you all for your help and contribution. I believe that together we can make a difference in our communities and it starts with us supporting one another. So please make your donation today. With your help, I know we can make it happen!

During more of 6 months we have improved all the Linux OS trying to make it faster, more intuitive, and useful to the average user and for professionals, the result was CMOS.

CMOS means: Code Matrix Operative System.

Now we need almost 400 k to improve our materials and work areas, launch the OS with a marketing campaign and to improve all the features to make the best OS.

CMOS has: Firefox, Skype, Spotify , terminal , Steam, Calibre, OpenShot Video Editor, CMOS audio system, CMOS video system, more than 83000 gadgets to personalize your computer , cinelerra, libreoffice, and much more surprises.

The OS has being already designed and all the purchases will be delivered before next year's June. The final version of CMOS will be totally free.

Don't worry if you are a gamer, you can play almost every game with CMOS.

We did our best and we bring you the safest and fastest OS in the world. Purchase it now if you want, it only cost 1$ and with it you will be helping us to make it better.

Thank you.

 

http://santiagosainzcapar.wixsite.com/0001/sing...

story:
About me

I grew up gardening and landscaping with my mom and have never been able to keep my hands out of the dirt.  Some people dream of being doctors or scientists, I dream about being an urban farmer. I’ve learned how to garden, had years of practice, and received a lot of mentorship from other gardeners and nurserymen around the county. I also have almost ten years of experience in customer service, sales, marketing, and supervising. All this has given me the encouragement I need to exit the daily office grind and go to work for myself. I plan to join the thousands of other small plot intensive farmers around the world and feed MY community with produce grown down the road rather than a few thousand miles away.

 

 

About our market

Almost Eden Gardens and Nursery is located right in the middle of Northwest Arkansas and, even more importantly, right in the middle of our city. Rather than being off out in the country, we have 4+ acres that occupies the middle of a city block. As a bonus, Almost Eden is less than five minutes from the main interstate that feeds the region. This location gives me the unique opportunity to sell the produce right off the farm rather than transporting it to a farmer’s market.  I also have close access to a bustling wholesale market of locally owned grocery stores and restaurants.

 

 

About the competition

Our region has exploded with small farms and a number of busy farmer’s markets. I am less than 15 minutes away from three Wal-Mart Super Centers, two Wal-Mart Neighborhood Markets, and three other locally owned grocery stores. All of that may sound like competition, but to me it sounds like there are plenty of people buying groceries. The locally owned grocery stores and various natural food stores are also a potential wholesale customer as they often have local produce available.

 

 

The risks

Weather, bugs, and diseases are the big three to worry about when dealing with plants. The primary reason I intend to keep growing nursery stock AND produce is to diversify where the income is coming from. Outlets for the market produce include Community Supported Agriculture (CSA), on farm sales, and wholesale sales to locally owned restaurants, hotels, and grocery stores.  The nursery stock will continue to be sold on the farm and shipped out through ecommerce.

 


The rewards

Who wouldn’t want a bag of fresh picked greens grown down the road instead of a bag of lettuce that was picked a week ago and shipped across the country? Carrots picked the day before instead of weeks before being sold? Potatoes dug a few days instead of months before being sold? Wouldn’t you want to see where your food came from, walk on the same dirt, see the plants, and meet the people that picked your tomatoes? 

For me, as a grower, the rewards come in tangible and intangible means. I get to support myself and my family doing something I love.  I get to support my community with fresh and healthy produce and plants.  I get to support our local environment by reducing, just a little bit, the amount of food that must be trucked 100s and even 1,000s of miles.

 

 

What have I put into the business?

I left my full time job and put my entire retirement into this expansion. That money will  buy seeds, planting and harvesting equipment, a hoop house, and it will help support myself and my family while the business grows (pun intended).  I purchased a small tractor two years ago that I use for breaking ground and moving dirt, compost, mulch, etc. around the property.  Of course, there are also the four + acres that the nursery and farm sits on that would probably be worth way more as an office and a parking lot.

 

 

The funds raised here will help me purchase…

-A BCS walking tractor: One of the most labor saving devices on a small, intensive farm. A walking tractor like the BCS allows for the gentle cultivation of our soil rather than ground-pounding tillage. It can also be fitted with an array of attachments so, unlike a conventional tiller, it is a multitasker not a unitasker. I have a Troy-Bilt tiller that we have been using (since 1985) has been dependable, but I’m afraid to task it with the demands of a full scale market garden.

-At least two unheated hoop houses: These will be used for season extension in the early spring and late fall so that I am able to supply fresh produce earlier and later in the season to the community. This will also provide a competitive edge against those farms that only grow in the summer.

-An expanded walk-in cooler: In order to keep all that produce fresh after harvest a walk-in cooler is a must.

-An apiary (a bee hive!): While not critical to the farm operation, bees are such a critical (and fragile) part of our ecosystem. The honey will be included, as available, in our weekly veggie boxes to add value for our customers.

-A chicken coop: You can’t deny it, eggs are tasty and chickens are fun to watch. I want to be able to add eggs, when available, to our veggies boxes. Chickens also produce fantastic fertilizer that, when composted, is the best thing since sliced bread for the garden.


Whether you live down the road or across the country supporting small, urban farmers is important. Our farm sizes are economical, sustainable, have minimal environmental impact, and a positive impact on our local communities.  East coast, west coast, or right in the middle we are feeding people with fresh and healthy produce that has been grown at home.

story:
Short Summary

I started playing Dungeons & Dragons in my kitchen with my father, friend and sister at the age of nine. Since then I have become passionate about gaming, learning and playing board games, Pokemon, YuGiOh and especially Magic: The Gathering. My children grew up playing games and learning respect, math, reading, and problem solving all while having fun. I want to bring that opportunity to the children in my community while also creating a space for adult gamers like myself to meet.

I am currently working on my Master's in Recreation, Sport and Tourism at the University of Illinois, and have a long history of jobs and life experience that has prepared me for owning this business.

We are working to open by this Spring, and this campaign will help to make that possible. The more money we raise the greater and larger the inventory we will have available to you in store. 

Your contribution whether $5 or $1000 will help make this happen. Let us know you are excited about this space.

What We Need & What You Get

We are working to raise funds for the startup costs and the first three months bills so that all revenue can be invested in more product. 

  • The perks could pay for themselves depending on how much you spend in store, and even if they don't you would be instrumental in helping this to happen.
  • If we don't reach the entire goal we will still be opening a store, it just might take a little longer. The perks will still be available once the store opens.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share the news with friends. Get the word out that we will be opening. 
  • Use the share tools to share this campaign on your social media, and tell people in person.

Short Summary
I started playing Dungeons & Dragons in my kitchen with my father, friend and sister at the age of nine. Since then I have become passionate about gaming, learning and playing board games, Pokemon, YuGiOh and especially Magic: The Gathering. My children grew up playing games and learning respect, math, reading, and problem solving all while having fun. I want to bring that opportunity to the children in my community while also creating a space for adult gamers like myself to meet.
I am currently working on my Master's in Recreation, Sport and Tourism at the University of Illinois, and have a long history of jobs and life experience that has prepared me for owning this business.
We are working to open by this Spring, and this campaign will help to make that possible. The more money we raise the greater and larger the inventory we will have available to you in store. 
Your contribution whether $5 or $1000 will help make this happen. Let us know you are excited about this space.

What We Need & What You Get
We are working to raise funds for the startup costs and the first three months bills so that all revenue can be invested in more product. 

The perks could pay for themselves depending on how much you spend in store, and even if they don't you would be instrumental in helping this to happen.
If we don't reach the entire goal we will still be opening a store, it just might take a little longer. The perks will still be available once the store opens.


Other Ways You Can Help

Share the news with friends. Get the word out that we will be opening. 
Use the share tools to share this campaign on your social media, and tell people in person.

story:
Hey Young World. The World Is Yours.

The perfect line from Legendary MC Slick Rick. The ideal mantra for our brand, Little Nomad. We are dedicated to creating and sourcing engaging and meaningful goods for your little ones. Our brand, inspired by curiosity, exploration, and community, aims to be a modern alternative to typical retailers. Our name aims to express the wonders of life shown by our little ones. It also serves as our family's acronym - Nora, Myka, Ant, Devan. 

 

Who We Are

Anthony has an extensive background in retail with roles on both the operational and visual side. He currently holds two jobs that directly speak to his passions. Working at the non-profit The Robinson Theater in North Church Hill VA, he is able to engage with and inspire his community on a daily basis. He also spends his mornings at Ledbury selling a top notch product and gaining even more retail insight. Nora is an Early Childhood Special Educator, graduating with her master's degree in Early Childhood Special Education from Virginia Commonwealth University. Recently, Nora became Adjunct Faculty in the School of Professional and Continuing Studies at The University of Richmond.

The Big Idea

The idea for Little Nomad came from an unexpected place. When we became parents in 2012,  we didn't anticipate such a supportive and welcoming community of families.  We didn’t expect to become friends with other adults simply because we both had children. We didn’t expect to be in a babysitting cooperative.

Out of conversations with other parents in our community grew an idea for a shop that we feel our city is missing - a modern children’s apparel shop. We want to provide a space where ALL feel comfortable and represented; a space that showcases high quality, independently produced items that are accessible in price; a space that highlights our local talent and makers.

Our Brands

We've started reaching out to vendors and have been overwhelmed by the response of some of our favorite brands! Here are a few that have committed to working with us so far. We are in "talks" with many other exciting brands. 

Oh My Baby

Shapes of Things

Kid and Kind

 

The Impact

Our City Needs This

Richmond is slated to become home to numerous new businesses. More young professionals and families are flocking to the city in numbers we havent seen in decades. New homes, apartments, and hotels are being built within close proximity. City dwellers expect access to local shopping opportunities. With such a rich history, the Jackson Ward neighborhood and Broad Street corridor make the perfect location for Little Nomad. After many years of neglect, this corridor is once again becoming a destination for locals and out of towners. Little Nomad fills a void in the local shopping scene.  

Partnerships and Collaborations are Important 

One of the best parts of being a small business is helping other small businesses find success. Our goal is to facilitate this success through our shop by using, selling, promoting, and collaborating with other great local products and businesses.

Brick and Mortar Retail Is Alive 

We see this space not only for retail, but as a space created for community focused events, including conversations with local authors and artists, civic meetings, networking gatherings, and workshops focused on the health and wellness of families and our children.

We understand that  selling a shirt isn't going to change the world, but we strongly believe we can change the narrative of what a locally owned shop can do and be for ALL of the community.

*Below is an example of a previous community event that we co-hosted. 

 

Here's Where Your Contribution Goes

With your help we will be able to make Little Nomad shop a reality. Thus far, we have used our business savings for marketing, branding, concept design, website design, licenses, hiring an accountant and lawyer, and deposit on a retail space. The funds you contribute will be used for standard retail start up expenses and assets detailed below.  

Risks & Challenges

Although we are very confident in the success of Little Nomad, all startups come with a certain amount of risk. 

However, we have no doubt we will overcome these risks by:  

  • Relying on strong retail experience    
  • High focus on leveraging Brick and Mortar with online sales
  • Creating strategic and consistent marketing campaigns
  • Working closely with mentors, other Broad Street merchants, and the city's economic development department to help Broad Street become the top shopping destination it deserves to be.                                                                                                          

Spread The Word!

There is no donation too small, but if you are unable to contribute monetarily, get creative! Use Indiegogo's share tools and use the hashtag #littlenomadcrew to tag us! Call your friends and tell them you want to see a new local kids store in Richmond! Calling not your thing? Email and text links of our campaign to your friends and family or share on your social media platforms. Let everyone know about the awesome perks we are offering with contributions. There is nothing we can't do when our community comes together! 

Thank you all so much for believing in us! Looking forward to seeing you in Little Nomad soon!

RVA's Reaction to Little Nomad

Use Indiegogo's share tools and use the hashtag #littlenomadcrew to tag us! Call your friends and tell them you want to see a new local kids store in Richmond! Calling not your thing? Email and text links of our campaign to your friends and family or share on your social media platforms. Let everyone know about the awesome perks we are offering with contributions. There is nothing we can't do when our community comes together! 
Thank you all so much for believing in us! Looking forward to seeing you in Little Nomad soon!
RVA's Reaction to Little Nomad

story:
When Zack was 6 years old he was playing in his room and got the idea to stuff his old Pajamas with balls from his ball pit then added his stuffed animal dog. Just like that Puppy Man was born.

After playing with the original Puppy, Man Zack and his dad went to the store and bought some stuffing and created the first Puppy Man with stuffing. Zack showed puppy man to his friends and many of them wanted their own.

Zack convinced his dad to make more Puppy Mans for his friends. After a lot of work and searching Zack and his dad were able to find a factory that could produce 18” and 36” stuffed animals. Launching this business has been a great learning experience for Zack where he has been able to take his idea from concept to production.

Puppy Man is the first stuffed animal in a line of stuffed animals called Pajama Pals that Zack is launching. We have had a number of Puppy Mans produced and ready to ship.

Puppy Man is offered in 18" & 36" sizes, and we are also offering a 18" & 36" Limited Collectors edition. The limited collectors edition will be the first 100 of each size shipped. They will come with a collectors edition Pajama Pals tag that is numbered and signed by Zack.  

Zack has a dream to build a factory in the USA and transform his many ideas into products. This is your opportunity to purchase his company’s first product, and be a key contributor to a 9-year-old boy’s first business venture.

We are aiming to raise $10k to help fund the initial launch of the business and if we are able to exceed this amount we will look to use the additional funds to launch up to 4 new Pajama Pals animals.

If you are inspired by this story please share it with your friends using the share buttons next to the Back it button at the top of this page. Imagine if when you were a kid someone helped turn one of your ideas into a business. Zack want's to make the world a happier place through making great products that inspire people. This is your opportunity to help Zack transform one of his many ideas into a business and watch how he and his company evolve over the years.  


                                             Frequently Asked Questions

What is the Limited Collector's Edition? The Limited Collector's Edition will be offered in 18" & 36" sizes, these stuffed animals will be the first 100 of each size sold. They will come with a special tag that is numbered and signed by Zack. As you can see Zack is an ambitious young boy and this is your opportunity to own a the first product created by his new company. 

What is the Original Puppy Man? The Original Puppy Man is the first production run of puppy man that is offered in 18" & 36" sizes. This dog comes with a Pajama Pals tag, information about Puppy Man and a UPC code for retail sale.

Does the zipper work? Yes Puppy Man comes with a working zipper that goes up and down, although his pajamas are attached to him and  can not be removed. 

Have Pajama Pals been safety tested? Yes our product was tested by a 3rd party company  to ensure that it meets or exceeds all US safety requirements.  These standards are very through ensuring all material is new, testing fire resistance, along with ensuring that components such as the eyes, nose, and zipper are safe.

What ages are Pajama Pals designed for? We have designed Pajama Pals for ages 3 - 100, but if you are over 100 we are pretty sure you will still enjoy a puppy man.

Where do you ship? We are currently offering free shipping in the USA.

Are Pajama Pals available in stores? Pajama Pals are available exclusively on Indiegogo as part of this campaign, and after the campaign will be offered on PajamaPals.net.

Can I buy one of the other animals? Puppy Man is currently available for sale, the other prototypes are in concept phase. If you really want one of the prototypes we would encourage you to share this campaign with your friends and help us achieve or funding goal. Excess funds from this campaign will be used to help fund new animals, and if we achieve the goal we will open additional Perks offering the prototypes.

Are you supporting any charities? Zack is looking into a number of charities to partner with, he is very passionate about helping others, but we don't have any official commitments yet.

 Aren't you a little young to run a business? Zack is 9 and very motivated to building his own business, but he is a kid and it's important for him to have kid time as well. This is a father son project that Dad and Zack are doing to help Zack learn about business and turn his ideas into reality. Dad has setup each step in the process of launching this business as a learning lesson for Zack where he can learn about the process and contribute at his ability level and interest. Dad's goal in helping Zack with this project was to help Zack understand what it takes to launch a business and turn his idea into a real product.



                                             Share Pajama Pals with your friends!

If you can't contribute we would still ask that you use the sharing tools next to the Back it button to share this campaign with your friend's or colleagues. Stuffed animals make a great gift for any kid, and we hope that Zack's story inspires other kids to fulfill their own dreams.

story:
The Stock Room

We are a Chicago designer and curator team that wants to engage the community by bringing together local designers and shoppers and activating empty and unused spaces with gallery-inspired retail installations—first in our Lincoln Park neighborhood and then around the city of Chicago.

The Stock Room is a chance for us to share our vision of great, compelling design, install a thought-provoking retail experience, and provide artists and designers a platform for exposure and business growth. Let's make it happen!

The Team

Origin story: 

Michelle is a designer, maker, and experience architect. She has done event design for M.A.C Cosmetics, product design for Martha Stewart Living and TAG Ltd., and exhibition design for the Chicago Design Museum. Mostly recently, she has launched her own design practice—MK Studio—which focuses on building unique experiences, spatial and product design, illustration, and graphic design. She moved to Chicago two years ago and never wants to leave.

Elizabeth, a Chicago native and world traveler, works as a design researcher and an independent curator. She has curated several exhibitions at the Chicago Design Museum as well as the Chicago Loop Alliance's June 2015 Activate event.

We met while collaborating at the Chicago Design Museum, where our passions and interests collided, and we've been friends and creative partners ever since.

The Mission

Helping launchThe Stock Room's inception will give us the opportunity to grow the Chicago design community and reach other design communities in the future, expose the public to new and interesting art and design, and create a different, fun, and unique retail experience. Our hope is that this will be the first of many pop-up experiences that engage the community and help give a boost to our designer and artist collaborators. 

Nitty Gritty

We are trying to raise $3,000 to cover the cost of the space, the build-out, and event supplies.

- Location, location, location. The right space is the best way to get the traffic, buzz, and momentum to make The Stock Room successful. Higher traffic areas and retail corridors are ideal for the premiere event.

- We want to actualize an exciting and engaging experience for the customer that makes The Stock Room a memorable and unique experience. That means supplies for display and merchandising that will set the stage to best showcase the talented designers involved.

- Start off with a bang! We want to launch with a opening party to generate buzz, get people into the store, and inspire them to tell others. Can't say no to a free drink and nom.

The Perks

Backers will get a range of great perks from The Stock Room stickers and buttons to discounts and a piece of The Stock Room history! Here are just a few:

- Buttons, stickers, and other memorabilia

- Discounts

- Invitation to a special closing event

- Piece of The Stock Room history

- Your name on the sponsor wall

No matter the end result of this Indiegogo campaign, your contribution will still help make The Stock Room the best it can be!

Money doesn't always talk

We would love your support, and, if you can't swing a dollar contribution, don't worry—you can still pitch in!

- If you know of anyone with an empty space in the Chicago, Lincoln Park area, that can host us for a week and is willing to work within our tight budget, let us know!

- If you know of any designers, makers, or artists that would be interested in collaborating, reach out!

We can't wait to make The Stock Room a reality!

story:
The Long and Winding Road to New Isle

  • My name is Anna Warren Cebrian. I own Illusive Comics & Games, LLC and Isle of Gamers. I purchased what is now Illusive Comics & Games in 2007. We added tabletop gaming to our shop in 2009. By 2014, that community had grown from a handful of dedicated World of Warcraft and Magic Gamers to about 30 squished-in gamers playing a variety of games every night.
  • I tried expanding the store, but our landlord was not terribly helpful. In early 2015, a space opened up right across the street. So we created Isle of Gamers, a 1700 square foot dedicated tabletop game store, capable of holding up to 70 gamers per night. I thought it would be cute having comics on one side of the street and gaming on the other. (Also, commercial real estate in the Silicon Valley is expensive and hard to come by for a good location.)  
  • We've outgrown that space in just three years. It became increasingly apparent that we need more room for gamers, gaming, and the love of games.
  • A business close to us closed about a year ago and the space remained vacant. Our lease is flexible, so we worked out a deal to move into this 3000 square foot space. 
  • We've transformed that RadioShack (with shelving on all of the walls and a hideous stock room) to a spacious shop where we can fit up to 100 gamers, complete with a themed private gaming room. Our property manager is bowled over.


Before & After

  • Change is scary. Moving is expensive. However, our community is incredibly supportive.

Our Needs, Your Deeds

  • We're raising funds to help cover the costs of remodeling and improving the NEW Isle of Gamers.  We've crafted a unique Pirate-themed private Gaming Room, added lockers for gamers to store their bags and gaming supplies, torn out old fixtures and added new drywall, paint, and decorations. We've also updated the bathroom to be ADA compliant (and suitably themed), repaired the floor, installed a new shelving system (which doubles the old shelf space), and hauled away the old shelves, wires, fixtures, and detritus (the trash haul alone cost $1300!). 
  • These limited edition items will only be available via this campaign-- they will not be available for purchase in-store. 

More Before & After

  • We still need more painting, electrical repairs, ceiling improvements, and other bits and bobs to make New Isle as completely eye-catching, warm, and fun to play in as the old place. But we're almost there.
  • In exchange for your support we are offering custom dice boxes, sponsorship of our Demo Game Library, custom dice, and more!

The Booty

  • Growing Isle of Gamers means Growing Our Community. We offer a beautiful and safe space that is open to kids, families, the LGBTQ community, women and everyone else who loves to game, make friends and have a fun time. 
  • We have become the niche location for casual gaming in the Silicon Valley. We host one of the largest Dungeons & Dragons communities on the West Coast and one of the largest Final Fantasy groups in the Bay Area.  
  • The reality of Silicon Valley is there aren't many affordable places where adults can hang out, make new friends and have fun. That is what we promote at Isle of Gamers. Tech Contractors come into the area for a few weeks or months and don't know where to find a geeky hangout. We offer Isle of Gamers as a place where they will find a warm welcome, a comfortable gaming space, and a large group of people who share their interests for a very low cost. 

What Could Possibly Go Wrong?

  • This is our third move/expansion in three years. We're becoming (tired) pros at this. 
  • We have the space, we have the talent. We're just hoping to make it... Lick-the-Walls Gorgeous.

No Money, No Problems!

  • Can't support us financially? That's ok! Please share this with your friends and fellow gamers so they not only know we've moved, but that they can get some awesome exclusive gaming stuff from this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools for easy Sharing! Apparently!
story_txt:
The Long and Winding Road to New Isle

My name is Anna Warren Cebrian. I own Illusive Comics & Games, LLC and Isle of Gamers. I purchased what is now Illusive Comics & Games in 2007. We added tabletop gaming to our shop in 2009. By 2014, that community had grown from a handful of dedicated World of Warcraft and Magic Gamers to about 30 squished-in gamers playing a variety of games every night.

I tried expanding the store, but our landlord was not terribly helpful. In early 2015, a space opened up right across the street. So we created Isle of Gamers, a 1700 square foot dedicated tabletop game store, capable of holding up to 70 gamers per night. I thought it would be cute having comics on one side of the street and gaming on the other. (Also, commercial real estate in the Silicon Valley is expensive and hard to come by for a good location.)  
We've outgrown that space in just three years. It became increasingly apparent that we need more room for gamers, gaming, and the love of games. 

A business close to us closed about a year ago and the space remained vacant. Our lease is flexible, so we worked out a deal to move into this 3000 square foot space. 
We've transformed that RadioShack (with shelving on all of the walls and a hideous stock room) to a spacious shop where we can fit up to 100 gamers, complete with a themed private gaming room. Our property manager is bowled over.

Before & After

Change is scary. Moving is expensive. However, our community is incredibly supportive.

Our Needs, Your Deeds

We're raising funds to help cover the costs of remodeling and improving the NEW Isle of Gamers.  We've crafted a unique Pirate-themed private Gaming Room, added lockers for gamers to store their bags and gaming supplies, torn out old fixtures and added new drywall, paint, and decorations. We've also updated the bathroom to be ADA compliant (and suitably themed), repaired the floor, installed a new shelving system (which doubles the old shelf space), and hauled away the old shelves, wires, fixtures, and detritus (the trash haul alone cost $1300!). 
These limited edition items will only be available via this campaign-- they will not be available for purchase in-store. 

More Before & After





We still need more painting, electrical repairs, ceiling improvements, and other bits and bobs to make New Isle as completely eye-catching, warm, and fun to play in as the old place. But we're almost there.
In exchange for your support we are offering custom dice boxes, sponsorship of our Demo Game Library, custom dice, and more!


The Booty


Growing Isle of Gamers means Growing Our Community. We offer a beautiful and safe space that is open to kids, families, the LGBTQ community, women and everyone else who loves to game, make friends and have a fun time. 
We have become the niche location for casual gaming in the Silicon Valley. We host one of the largest Dungeons & Dragons communities on the West Coast and one of the largest Final Fantasy groups in the Bay Area.  
The reality of Silicon Valley is there aren't many affordable places where adults can hang out, make new friends and have fun. That is what we promote at Isle of Gamers. Tech Contractors come into the area for a few weeks or months and don't know where to find a geeky hangout. We offer Isle of Gamers as a place where they will find a warm welcome, a comfortable gaming space, and a large group of people who share their interests for a very low cost. 


What Could Possibly Go Wrong?

This is our third move/expansion in three years. We're becoming (tired) pros at this. 
We have the space, we have the talent. We're just hoping to make it... Lick-the-Walls Gorgeous.


No Money, No Problems!

Can't support us financially? That's ok! Please share this with your friends and fellow gamers so they not only know we've moved, but that they can get some awesome exclusive gaming stuff from this campaign.
Use the Indiegogo share tools for easy Sharing! Apparently!

story:
WE HAVE STARTED ANOTHER FUNDRAISER ROUND TO MAKE OUR GOAL!! PLEASE VISIT OUR ROUND II FUNDRAISER!! 

Hello!

 

SoundSpace is looking to become Asheville’s first full-fledged music practice space facility. We will be serving the critical needs of the music community, touring and local musicians alike. Soundspace will be created as a place of support for artists amidst the rapidly growing industry of music in the area.

Soundspace believes it will serve as a powerful, creative hub that will help to enrich and grow Asheville’s vibrant music scene, strengthening the abilities of anyone who wishes to play an instrument, while providing workspace for our many music professionals.

SoundSpace is managed and owned by musicians Claude Coleman Jr. and Brett Spivey, both Asheville residents with lifelong careers in music and studios domestically and abroad, in addition to having experience as builders and studio owners themselves.

SoundSpace at Rabbit's will feature state-of-the-art music rehearsal spaces, hourly, and monthly rental spaces, and a dance/movement studio.

SoundSpace will also feature a soul-food café. The property we are trying to acquire is the famed Rabbit’s Café and Motel, in the Southside area of downtown. We are thrilled to honor the legacy and history of Rabbit’s Café and Motel and humbled to partner with Clarence Robinson (#FlavorKing) A-B Tech Culinary Graduate and local chef who grew up behind the Motel and is a relative of the original owner. The motel was used for the touring Negro baseball leagues, of which Asheville had a dominant team. We wish to feature murals on our building sides that will honor all of this history!

 

What We Need!

SoundSpace is seeking $70,000 to cover purchasing the property and complete renovation of the property to provide four state-of-the-art rehearsal rooms in the motel, averaging 13'x17' each, a soul-food kitchen, a lounge and office space in the front.

Anything over this amount or even close to this amount will bring us closer to our goal of a project that we are not giving up on!

 

Our Perks!

We appreciate and are deeply humbled by the love and support we receive!! When you contribute to this campaign, you are contributing to the health and future of not only artists in need but to art itself. These are gifts to thank you!

Shout out on digital media!
We'll blast our thanks to you across all of our social networks!

Personalized thank you postcard!
    A retro-style motel postcard of Rabbit's with a personalized thanks, to you!

Retro Rabbit’s Motel Keychain
    A neato old motel key tag with SoundSpace and Rabbit's on the tag!

Name recognition at the SoundSpace facility!
    We'll have a wall for the supporters who made the dream happen - you'll name will join the others on the wall!

10% Rehearsal Time
    Discount off of your first rental time with SoundSpace!

1, 2,3 and 4 -hours of Rehearsal Time
     Time in the shed, on us!

SoundSpace Punch Card
    The SoundSpace punch card with a few punches removed, towards a free hour rental!

Special edition SoundSpace T-shirt
    The SoundSpace special edition Tee!

Invitation to Special VIP party at SoundSpace grand opening
    We'll have a preliminary meet and greet hang at our grand opening gig/party, and you'll have special invite!

10% off the Kitchen/Cafe
    Discount for our soul-food kitchen/cafe's vittles, run by Clarence Robinson!

Name On A SoundSpace Rehearsal Room Door
    Your name added to the door of a rehearsal room!

The Stay Forever Perk 

Our newly added Perk!! You will get two guest list tickets to live Ween, anywhere on planet Earth, FOR LIFE!! Starting right now! Plus 100 hours of rehearsal time!! Plus all the other perks! THIS PERK IS GIFTABLE - Gift the tickets and rehearsal hours away to a loved one!! This could cover a weekly rehearsal for over a year!!

 

The CCJ Drumkit '99 - '13
    This was CCJ's main and solely owned drum kit used for Ween and everything else he ever did for an over-ten year period.  Everything on record with Ween and beyond during this time period. Recording after recording, tour after tour, gig after gig, appearance after appearance, and appears in more than several music photography books. It literally has probably had 870,000,000 hours on it and 35,000,00 miles of travel. It's priceless - and for the superfan!! 

- Red Rocks '09 -

 

 

SoundSpace will be community based and created by musicians. There will be discounted time-periods, free rentals to music students, and workshops and clinics. Our rooms will be fully decoupled and soundproofed, great for recording rehearsals as well as providing the most isolation from room to room. SoundSpace will have a staffed office, safe surroundings and will start with late hours eventually going to 24 hours.

Having this resource for the area's many musicians will be nothing short of a game changer. It will enhance the industry of music as a whole, and it will give support for more creative work to occur.  SoundSpace will also be invaluable to the many touring acts coming to the city, thereby becoming an excellent utility for the city's music venues.

The Team at SoundSpace is a dedicated and passionate group of Asheville business folks that share our same passion and drive, and we wish to thank them for their fierce dedication and energy: consultants Annice Brown and Jennifer Flynn, the office of Covestar Investment Realty and Jessica Auge, and special thanks to Erika McGilley at Natural Capital Investment Fund(NCIF).

 

"First There is A Mountain, Then There is No Mountain, Then There Is...."

We have been developing SoundSpace for close to three years now. We have searched and searched only to come close and lose the deal more than several times over, in our efforts to find the right property with a willing owner. With each hurdle overcome, we have become stronger and closer to the vision.  Claude Coleman Jr. and Brett Spivey are both illness and trauma survivors with decades of grit, patience and passion in music, and stubborn energy that will see SoundSpace towards fruition. Won’t you join us?

 

 

Share Us!!

Please share our fundraiser everywhere you can and help us make noise!

And please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Share Us!!

story:
Who we are

We are two dreamers from Chennai, India, who have ditched our engineering lives to travel and work at various hostels across India and since realized the fun in serving backpackers. We have decided to open a backpacking hostel and yoga retreat space in Varkala, Kerala, India. Help us turn this dream into reality. 

Our inspiration

Ever seen a short giraffe: the outcast that chose to write its own rules, spurning tradition? All you ingenious nomads, lugging a backpack, sauntering through bizarre lands, grappling against all hurdles and language barriers, choosing not to embrace the 9 to 5 drudgery, dancing to your rhythm, curious to explore and engage with the world are all short giraffes.

To all you misfits out there busy sharing laughs and love, bringing people together, making an impact wherever you go and being the change, this space is crafted for you, but, no puking please. :-P

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this with friends, family, co-workers, strangers and anyone else who may be interested in supporting two young entrepreneurs who are eager to make an impact by leaving a positive footprint on this planet.

story:
Our Story.

My name is Iona, and I was brought up loving food and ingredients. My dad owned a restaurant when I was a kid and took us out picking nettles and gathering sloes; which sparked a passion... I later became a single mother to Steil, my eldest son, and was for most of his life. During that time I have worked in an Artisan Bakery with pastry, and in a Biodynamic butchers (I make a mean wild garlic sausage!). More recently have taught courses in foraging as Ashdown Forage and worked cooking as a private chef for families and businesses.

I had run Ashdown Forage for several years, teaching foraging and preserving and brewing courses on a small scale, including catering. But as a single mother and without funds, expanding it to encompass all that I love or could do seemed impossible. Then I met Josh. We fell pregnant fast and he was (and is) the most supportive partner and father, and was enthusiastic not only to support me in my dream, but to grow it to include his dream of a self-propelled future, of creating a community space that supports musical artists and nourishes through music. Of being able to support our family and ourselves by doing things that we love, and that benefit others. Because of him and as a team, anything feels possible. Including raising enough money to make this dream a reality. And that is where you come in!

THE FOODIE FORAGER Ethical Festival and Events Caterer.

We started The Foodie Forager because I love good, real, whole food, that doesn't feel austere. We love turning relatively lowly ingredients and foraged flourishes into food that nourishes not only the body, but also the soul. The feeling of community created by nurturing people, the difference it can make to the atmosphere, and the feeling of pride when everyone feels like they are being looked after and taken care of in this way, is palpable. I am passionate about reducing food waste within our own kitchens and as a nation, and I'm expanding into online courses that will incorporate this, as well as running in-person courses at events. I also believe great crew are an asset and should be valued as such. A good friend often says 'Do what you love, it's your gift to Universe'... I am inclined to agree.

 

Last year We were fortunate enough to secure funding to start from an amazing Social Enterprise called Foragers Farm. We had our first season last summer, which was truly amazing, and saw significant parts of our dream come to life. It was an incredible experience and we learnt so much. Most importantly it showed us where we would like to improve!

  

  • We would like our own space so that we can make it as beautiful and comfortable as we can
  • We would like our own vehicle to cut down costs on renting vehicles either end of an event.
  • We want to be able to pay staff properly so that no one feels overworked
  • We need a beautiful sign that people can see from far off

 

Some of these issues our wonderful friends have stepped up to solve. Against the grain carpentry and joinery are making us a beautiful wooden counter. The wonderful Ruth Bloomers has offered to make us some signs, and our lovely friend Julian has designed a logo that we can have blown up to put on vinyl signs so that we are visible from a distance. But other things we need help with and it will make or break our business.

What we need!

This is a breakdown of what we would spend funds raised on, in order of priority!

 

Marquee - £7000

Not only will this enable us to save money on hiring, we can own and create a unique and beautiful space which will have been designed to both fit our business and sumptuously envelope our customers. We would be free to apply for bigger public events and private functions like weddings etc.

We want to give our community a place that feels like a second home. We have found a beautiful marquee that would be visible across fields and look stunning in all settings and events. I'm a little bit in love.

 

Van - £2500

This would save us rental money on every gig and event that we do and enable us to fit more in our space, as we could customise the interior to best suit our needs. We would have more time at each booking and would allow us to bring a second small set-up as a teaching space for foraging food waste courses.

 

Hog Roast Machine - £2500

This would open up many more events from bonfire nights to weddings and enablers to stretch our season and realise our dream to be completely self-sufficient as a family.

Sound system - £250 - £beyond!!

This would completely change the atmosphere in our cafe and transform us from a place to go to eat, to a venue. Somewhere to relax with music... It would allow us to support the wonderful musicians and artists that make the work we do and the places we do it so special. As our budget is already big we have started with the price of a small system to play recorded music on, but should we exceed our target, the extra funding would go towards a proper sound system and the extra solar power to run it.

______________________________________________________________

 

All of these things would immediately reduce overheads, increase our income and enable us to pay all of our core crew a living wage. If we don't reach our full target we would consider borrowing money to fulfil the first 3 of these goals. The alternative is to buy scaled down versions of the same things.

 

We are continually humbled by the love and encouragement of those people who support us and so we thought it a good time to ask for your help to realise our dream. With your help, this will become a reality.

 

Challenges.

We are aware that the path we have chosen isn't the easiest one. There will be challenges, from making sure we have enough bookings and great crew, to navigating the much increased admin and paperwork that come with growing a business to the next level, but we are certain that with the amazing support network we are already so fortunate to have watched grow around us, and our genuine passion for what we are creating, we are in a fantastic position to tackle and overcome those and any other challenges we encounter in our path.

The exciting bit! What you get:

We have some seriously epic perks in store for you, from a chef for a private function, a copy of the course that will help you get your kitchen and your budget in order and turn out impressive real food, to a personal cupboard consultation to plan meals and recipes around what you have in the house and your dietary needs. And if you think there is something we can do that you would pay for, get in touch! We are Happy to add a perk, just for you.

WHAT ELSE YOU CAN DO?

PLEASE PLEASE share this as far and wide as you can, the more people that know about this, the better. For us, and for your belly.

The Rub.

Essentially, we want to create a hub. A beating heart of whatever festival or event we are at… to welcome you in to relax in comfort, to be cared for and nourished, to take time out from whatever else is going on and just be, with your community. While your kids play with sand or water in our kids’ corner, you can drink locally sourced hand roasted coffee and eat food created with ethical consideration, and your needs in mind and heart. I genuinely can't wait. <3

 

Much love, Iona, Josh, Steil and Alexei

story:
Red Dragon Gaming is a community focused game store in New Ulm, Minnesota. Our open play area provides a place for gamers to find others who share their interersts, and our game demos and workshops make it easier than ever for new players to find games they love. For the more established players, we have tournaments and leagues where they can pit their skills against others and see who is top of the game.

Who We Are

Red Dragon Gaming is the fault of Allen "AJ" Juhnke, a lover of RPGs and table-top wargames. Moving to New Ulm from St. Cloud, AJ missed the joy of hanging out at a friendly local game store and realized that if he wanted to have that experience in his new home, he'd have to provide it himself. For AJ, the community is everything, and he's willing to sacrifice whatever it takes to support it.

AJ brought his friend and sometimes Dungeon Master Travis Theurer into the project as soon as he realized that opening a store was too much work for one person. Travis has been gaming for more than 20 years and he is looking forward to encouraging new players to pick up and try games for the first time. You can often find him standing at the demo tables encouraging people to check out the latest game.

Julie Lovell agreed to be a part of Red Dragon Gaming so that she could encourage more young girls and women to be a part of the gaming community. It is her fervent desire that the stereotype of gaming being a male pasttime be thoroughly smashed. She knows that there is much more to gaming beyond simple competition and one-upsmanship that most women never get a chance to experience.

What We Need

 

 

Products - Half of the funds raised will be going directly into products to put on the shelves. These include Magic boosters, D&D books, Warhammer miniatures, DiceMasters sets, and board and other games, as well as pop, chips, energy drinks, and candy bars.

Tables & Chairs - These will be heavy-duty tables and chairs for use in the gaming area. We're looking to start with 10 tables and 60 chairs. As the store grows, we will add additional tables and chairs.

Cash Register - We have no idea why these things are so expensive, but they are. This covers the cost of the computer itself, the barcode scanner, the receipt printer and the cash drawer, everything needed to complete a transaction and let you take your new toys home.

Misc. - You want the store to be clean and well lit; so do we. In addition to light bulbs to keep things bright and cleaning supplies to keep things shiny, this also covers printer paper (for those tournament pairings), poker chips (for our poker nights), and any other incidental item that we haven't yet realized we're going to need.

What You Get

Supporting Red Dragon Gaming makes you special, and everyone needs to know just how special you are. To achieve this, every physical item that we are offering as part of this campaign will be branded with "I Gave the Dragon Life" a unique slogan that will never again be offered. Show it to your friends and family so that they can see just how special you are.

Store Credit - A portion of your contribution will be made available to you as store credit after we open. The exact details are not yet finalized, but rest assured, we are looking for ways to give you back as much or your contribution as we can. Watch for updates discussing our thought processes, and provide any feedback you can.

Coffee Mug - This coffee mug is stainless steel with a removable lid for easy cleaning. On one side will be the Red Dragon Gaming logo, and written across the other will be the campaign slogan, "I Gave the Dragon Life"

T-Shirt - Our t-shirts come in your choice of colors and a variety of sizes. Emblazoned upon the front will be the Red Dragon Gaming logo, and written across the back will be the campaign slogan, "I Gave the Dragon Life"

Shopping Bag - This canvas shopping bag is perfectly sized to carry all of your purchases out of the store, or carry all of your favorite games down to the open play area for some good times with friends. On each side of the bag you will find the Red Dragon Gaming Logo, beneath which will be the campaign slogan, "I Gave the Dragon Life"

Name Plaque - This plaque will be prominantly displayed upon the wall of Red Dragon Gaming, listing the names of the Friends of the Dragon. Each name will be engraved into an individual metal plate, and the plates will be mounted onto a beautiful wooden panel.

Photo Plaque - Reserved for our most giving backers, each Blood of the Dragon backer will be featured on an individual plaque prominately displayed in the store. These commemorative plaques will feature a photograph of the backer, along with their name, personal quote, and other information engraved into a metal plate.

Coupons/Discounts - Any of the coupons or discounts that are available can be used in the store itself and on our webstore. 

What Your Contributions Mean

Reaching our campaign goal will ensure that we can open Red Dragon Gaming debt free, setting us on a course to remain open for years to come. By removing the financial burdens normally associated with starting a business, you are allowing us to focus on what you want most, games, tournaments, leagues, and events. Never will we have to choose between holding an exciting event and paying the utility bill to keep the lights on.

Risks & Challenges

In spite of all of the preparation that has gone into opening Red Dragon Gaming, no business venture is without risk. Unexpected costs always have a way of cropping up when a business can least afford it. The greatest risk that we face is that such a cost may be to much for us to bear, leaving us with no choice but to close our doors.

We are taking every precaution that we can think of to protect ourselves from this risk. We have insurance against theft, fire, liability, etc. All of our fixtures are checked to make sure they are of the highest quality. And, only professionals are performing the remodelling to ensure that all work is completed satisfactorily 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support us financially, that doesn't mean that you can't help us. Tell your friends about our campaign. Share it on Facebook, Twitter, and other social media platforms using the share tools right on the campaign page. And, most importantly, stop into the store once we've opened and play some games. This whole endeavor is for the community. You are more than welcome.

story:
Hello my name is Chef Shane Caledonia (some people call me chef, but there is no need for formalities..). After 30 years of learning the food business inside and out while in restaurants, on college campuses, and serving corporate giants I have finally decided to pursue my dream, but I need a little help from you!!!

I need help because with very short notice my position with one of the "big three" food service companies was unexpectedly eliminated. Although this is definitely a blessing in disguise, I had not planned on it therefore I simply did not have all of the funds available to start this new venture. I have scraped together most of what I need with the help of family and friends, but I need a little boost!

Here is a little about us.

   The "Baby's Bonetown BBQ" food truck concept finally came to life in the fall of 2016.

We will serve authentic truck smoked bbq, sauces, and sides. In a geography starved for “great” bbq Baby’s will bring a top quality BBQ that reflects the passions of a true journeymen of the culinary craft. With a unique look and feel, great food and outstanding personality Baby’s will be the premier bbq truck in the Greater Providence, greater Boston and Metro South areas.

Whether eating lunch on the go or taking home dinner for the family, Baby’s is here to serve. From tender brisket, pulled pork, and ribs to creamy mac & cheese and spicy collards, your taste buds are guaranteed a mouth rockin’ experience! Look for us in the downtown Providence area this spring or book us for your event or house party!

Baby’s will also offer full service catering to meet any need including:

Corporate Luncheons/Outings

Private Dinner Parties

Weddings

Graduations

Holiday Parties

Etc…

Our team has vast experience in all levels of catering. Chef Shane will work with you to create a menu and design events that will exceed your expectations!

Your contributions will help to bring this all to life!

story:
Hello, my name is Bill (willy to some) and I have been in the food
and beverage industry for over 30 years. For years I have worked, managed,
and consulted in this industry. I have researched trends and venues for
over 25 years trying to find the perfect combination of product and venue
to perform some culinary magic. I believe with all my heart that this is just
such a combination. Delicious food and drink when and where the people
want it.
   While major parts of this project have been purchased personally,
and some donated by friends who believe in me and my plan; I find myself just
a bit short of achieving my goal. I have a truck, most materials and even
have been accepted to a few music festivals this summer (provided we are ready)
All we are lacking is a few finishing points.

The oven, the heart of it all,small, quick and powerful

Electrical  (inverters, couplers, fuse block, etc)

Paint and logo work

Fees paid to the state,county, city, board of health

Festival fees

    I have broken down my project's remaining expenses and figured that $5200 should get this truck rolling down the highway. If this were a food-pod truck we could do more of the work ourselves, but as a mobile unit that will sometimes be at a festival without power, I feel its best to have a professional finish the critical systems. Between my friends and I we can do most anything (construction, plumbing, metal fab, automotive modification) It's the power systems that must be done correctly right from the start.
   The image (graphics) must be crisp and clean. Oregon Blue Print (OBP) has given us the best price I could ever hope for, and free design (redesign) help. Their expertise has helped in so many ways, that they are my go to source for for all the graphics.
   Amazingly these main items and a few finishing pieces (specialty related) and permits (fees) to the government and festivals is all that is needed to finish.
   SO, whats in it for you? Quite a bit actually. I am offering multiple levels for contributors and rewards at every level. Thanks are always appreciated, but swag is better. We have friends making us all sorts of custom items to give to contributors. Some we have listed and some we have set aside to drop in randomly to contributors at every level. We have random items such as hoodies, hats, and even ZIPPO brand lighters, all limited edition and all with our primary logo on them.
Everyone who helps to get this truck rolling will receive a special first month gift
when they show up at the truck as well.
   Should we fall short of our goal (let's not please) I will use every penny to
purchase the most critical of items and them work double time to fill in the gap.
My hope is to have this up and running by the end of February
(I can do it if you all help). I will be launching a twitter account on the last day of
this campaign to keep everyone updated the progress and official opening date and location(s).
For now there is a face book page that provides a bit more information.
https://www.facebook.com/Willyswienerwagon/

   As with any venture into the food and beverage industry, nothing is a sure thing.
That being said, I will not rest until everyone of you feels we have made something great.
For over 18 years I have helped failing small businesses turn things around. This experience has left me with a unique set of skills and abilities to tackle even the toughest of obstacles. With your help this truck will be seen all over Oregon this summer and for many to come. If you can't help with a contribution, please share this campaign with your friends and family. Help get the word out, and thank you all for your interest in making  "the wagon" a success.

story:
Our GiG of a Lifetime

For the past several months our biggest gig has been planning, research and development on an app that can simplify the way we do ordinary and extraordinary things. Because everyday tasks range from the boring and mundane to the surprising and unexpected, our planning and our end product will be similarly complex and flexible. Our goals, however, are very precise.

While our life might involve hundreds of different gigs a day we only have one and it’s called GiGaround. And we take it very seriously. But before we can provide the best crowd-sourced solutions we need to crowd-source some help from you. 

A GiG for Everyone

The idea for GiGaround was born along with a renewed sense of community developing in Cyprus after years of austerity and under the influence of that growing revolution known as the Uberisation of industry. Our founders saw the power of crowd-sourcing, civic duty and neighborly actions but didn't have a problem of seeing the crowd for the people. We see that everyone has a unique gig they were born to rock! With our technology, efficiency and real-time precision we can empower you to find the perfect fit for what you need, or let you become the perfect fit for someone else’s job.

GiGaround's Goals

With your help, the completed GiGaround mobile application will be an advanced real-time peer-to-peer hiring platform (known also as a service-based marketplace) placing emphasis on community relationships, user rewards and reviews.  

From the beginning, our investment, planning and focus has never strayed from GiGaround's three primary goals:

  • To acquire a well built and secure mobile application with industry leading native architecture, Yii framework for web platforms and MVC backend capabilities as a foundation for GiGaround's marketplace.
  • To maintain sufficient marketing and business infrastructure so as to attract and retain an awesome community of GiGsters that will make our marketplace prolific and dependable.

  • To implement, enforce and monitor a rock solid rating system that guarantees the reputation and efficiency of GiGsters as well as the quality of task completion.

How it Works

1 .    SEARCH and REQUEST

A user registers, provides basic details, fees range/budget and types of preset interests and activity tags. They can Search for GiGsters using these tags or Request a GiGster for a real-time task with pricing and timeline constraints.

2.     MATCHING

User contacts a GiGster who applies to the search tag or receives a real-time notification from an available GiGster who is interested in the terms. The user can analyze potential GiGsters according to reputation and reviews. Next, a basic communication client within the app is initiated between the two users. Within that client they further refine price, timeline or any other terms and conditions.

Chat in the beginning phase of a gig ensures maximum possible anonymity to each user's profile. Once further details have been refined and a preliminary contract is accepted from the chat moves to a second more visible and interactive state including image/file sharing and most importantly, GPS tracking. 

3.     TRACKING

The advanced communication client remains open to track the ETA of the GiGster and the progress of the contract. After the service is completed (whether remotely or in person), the GiGster will initiate a completion request with a proof input value (description, image/file) to be confirmed by the user in order to initiate payment phase.

If there is a rejection, complaint or any related dispute a flag will be raised and the issue will be forwarded to admins outside of the native app. The user will be immediately notified and moved to browse other nearby GiGsters providing similar services. Specific flags and repeat offenders can result in disciplinary action.

4.     PAYMENT

Pауmеnt іѕ fast аnd simple, оnсе the tаѕk has been completed. Whеn both thе сuѕtоmеr аnd user meet fасе to fасе and the task is executed, or if the terms have been fulfilled remotely, рауmеnt takes place аutоmаtісаllу according to user preference on registration.

It's a ѕесurе, “wіn-wіn” аrrаngеmеnt fоr bоth раrtіеѕ. The customer then moves to a rating screen to evaluate the GiGster's services. Rating іѕ enforced and essential tо GiGaround bесаuѕе it hеlрѕ a nеw сuѕtоmеr decide whether to approve a ѕеrvісе provider bеfоrе booking a tаѕk. It аlѕо hеlрѕ tо buіld trust in our community.

App Completion Timeline

Once funding is secured there will be three development milestones which will only require 17 weeks in total to complete. 

1st Milestone (Foundation Phase) - 5 weeks 

2nd Milestone (50% Development Completion) - 6 weeks

3rd Milestone (100% Development and Debugging Completion - 6 weeks

Supporting GiGaround

The distance between what we have and what we envision is not far off and this is why we are choosing Indiegogo and, particularly, its “keep it all model” of funding for this project. We have currently invested heavily in this project and are committed to the community that we’ve envisioned and you’ve been intrigued enough to research this far. And by the way, we appreciate it!

So what happens if you decide to go beyond curiosity and join the GiGaround community? Look into our perk offers or visit our website for more!
