It's a ѕесurе, “wіn-wіn” аrrаngеmеnt fоr bоth раrtіеѕ. The customer then moves to a rating screen to evaluate the GiGster's services. Rating іѕ enforced and essential tо GiGaround bесаuѕе it hеlрѕ a nеw сuѕtоmеr decide whether to approve a ѕеrvісе provider bеfоrе booking a tаѕk. It аlѕо hеlрѕ tо buіld trust in our community.

App Completion Timeline
Once funding is secured there will be three development milestones which will only require 17 weeks in total to complete. 
1st Milestone (Foundation Phase) - 5 weeks 
2nd Milestone (50% Development Completion) - 6 weeks
3rd Milestone (100% Development and Debugging Completion - 6 weeks
Supporting GiGaround
The distance between what we have and what we envision is not far off and this is why we are choosing Indiegogo and, particularly, its “keep it all model” of funding for this project. We have currently invested heavily in this project and are committed to the community that we’ve envisioned and you’ve been intrigued enough to research this far. And by the way, we appreciate it!
So what happens if you decide to go beyond curiosity and join the GiGaround community? Look into our perk offers or visit our website for more!

story:
Red's Story

At Red’s Smokehouse, we are all committed to sharing our love of BBQ with as many people as we can. The best way we know how to spread happiness is by giving people food they love!

Our specialty is smokehouse style BBQ with a twist. Our full menu includes smoked, boldly flavored, seasonal dishes. We focus on using local products and partner with local and family owned businesses whenever possible. We believe that by creating a restaurant that offers the best ingredients, most delicious flavors, and the friendliest people, our customers will keep coming back for more.

Red has spent years cooking in a variety of kitchens - everywhere from the UP to Tennessee. She has worked her way up from fast food kitchens to fine dining! If you ask her, the most rewarding part of being a chef is seeing people thoroughly enjoy the recipes you have perfected!

Bring Red's Food to Her Favorite Community

The Eastside community is where the business started and where it was meant to expand. This is the reason for this specific space and the needs for the funds. With the goal of opening our new restaurant in early 2017, we’ve got a lot of work to do. The new 1,200-square-foot space will include a state of the art kitchen, a small dining area, a deli, and a take-out counter. We are converting an old office space from the ground up!

Building a restaurant is serious business and seriously expensive! To make this a reality, we need your help!

The entire build-out will cost us at least $80,000. We are asking for $40,000. Yes, that’s some serious cash, but by getting this support, we will be able to keep our food prices down for the residents of our community!   

The funds we raise will be used for:

  1. Converting office space into fully-functional restaurant
  2. Health Department permits and fees
  3. Equipment: freezer, grill, fridge, stove
  4. Contractor fees: plumbing, electrical

Sense of Community

The Eastside community of Lansing has always supported us and we want to do our part in offering them great food at an affordable price. We want to help the community thrive and that means keeping our prices reasonable and hiring local employees. To support other local food startups, we plan to feature vendors in the kitchen on different nights of the week. We will also create a space for one of our favorites local bakers - Gluten Free Rox! We truly believe we are all stronger together!  

Risks & Challenges

The risk is high to start a new restaurant business and we know that the key to success is to provide a quality product with great service. If we do not get all the funds needed, we will delay the deli for a few months. There is many challenges as you build out a space, planning is key and we have a solid plan in place.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Ask folks to get the word out for us and please share with friends and family
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share too!
  • We will need many hands to help with decor and flooring install, come give us a hand!

story:
OUR VISION: ONE GREAT COMMUNITY BOOKSTORE



                                                 BEFORE - 2014 - A troublesome party store

                                      AFTER - 2017 - A thriving independent bookstore!

 

“Whenever you read a good book, somewhere in the world a door opens to allow in more light.” -Vera Nazarian

 

            Exterior store sign

 

Totem Books is much more than Flint, Michigan's only bookstore. As Flint and Totem continue to fight back from the water crisis, books, literacy, and community are now more important than ever. We are working hard every day to provide a one-of-a-kind community gathering place where we can all be different together. Here at Totem, people from all different backgrounds find a spiritually uplifting space to share ideas, eat healthy food, and experience those very special books that have been looking for them.

We've hosted many free cultural events, lecturers, performances, educational exhibits, and storytellers. We have also been involved with various community projects and partnerships. Most recently we partnered with Flint's Mass Transit Authority (MTA), Sit On It Detroit, and Habitat for Humanity to create five bus stop reading benches in our neighborhood. These benches house free books that Totem provides for people to take and read as they wait for the bus. We also offer free books in the foyer of our store. We have given away thousands of books to individuals and non-profit groups.

 

       

Writer & political activist, John Sinclair

Local author book signing

   

              

                    Vinyl records fixture    

                Cafe menu board

 

   

                  Meeting space  

                  Children's section

 

If we reach our goal, here is how we plan to spend the money:

$ 3,000 for one year’s maintenance and inventory for the MTA bus stop book benches

$5,000 will be used to develop Flint youth who will be trained in e-commerce skills that will assist Totem’s path to sustainability while providing them with a marketable skill.

$ 5,000 to fund and support partnered community programs including the Greater Flint Arts Council, Flint Creative Alliance, Flint Handmade, and others.

A minimum of $10,000 will assist in operational costs.

$ 6,000 for six months of community outreach through radio, television, and print media.

$ 6,000 to host a year-long schedule of free community events (including our weekly children’s storytime, monthly book club, open mic nights, artwalk, healthy living series, funk Friday, local author book signings, and local lecture series).

We are asking you to donate to our campaign and invest in Totem Book's and Flint's future.        Thank you!

story:
English version

A GREAT STORY...

I am Catherine, a woman passionate about life and creation, and especially from the period 1900 to 1935.

In the interwar years, a new generation dreamed of a new world and proclaimed
"Never again!". These years, called the «Roaring Twenties» or the 1920s, have produced incredible creativity accross the world in all fields: artistic, industrial, cinematographic ...

Fashion and design underline the tragedy of the First World War.

This page of History corresponds to me. This joyful and creative resilience resonates in me. So much so that I launched in March 2017 the Creations of the Unicorn to bring back this spirit.
I chine and restore old objects: old lace, patinated furniture, tarnished mirrors, dented jewelry ... all have a soul and tell their little story in great history.

I create, sew and make. headbands, hats or dresses, feathers and pearls, lace and embroidery ... I rely on my creative talent and the technical and artistic legacy of my grandmother Louise. Clothing designer, she passed on her passion, her vision and her know-how.

Today, I come to share with you this universe and this joyful inspiration.

And I need you is to continue this positive vision of history and the world, and to grow my business.

Today, I sew my creations and restore old objects stuck on a corner table in my living room.
I dream of opening my own shop to welcome my clients, to expose my original creations as well as the collection of furniture and objects that I have found.

My shop would also be my workshop where I could present the fabrics, beads and feathers with which I work. I could sew, embroider, advise and train at this time very present in my daily life.

To develop my business, I need two machines to make Cornely embroidery to enrich my embroidery creations. A profession that I have practiced previously and that my mother can always teach me because she was a Cornely embroiderer and realized the 1st models for the greatest fashion designers such as Christian Lacroix.

I also need a van rather than a car to be able to transport all my equipment in the various fairs and events in which I participate in France or accross the world. I also need them to transport the furniture I make to prepare them and then deliver them if necessary to my clients.

Little by little I built a clientele that buy my creations be it wedding dresses, evening dresses, headband and hats, but also the furniture that I restore in Shabby style. I also became a reference in that historical period. I also realize creative workshops with beginngers that I hope will be able to welcome in a better way in my workshop-boutique or in differents places, cities and countries.

Recently, a customer ordered me a dress for climbing the stairs in Cannes. A couple ordered furniture from me to decorate their bed and breakfast.

For example, I am invited to represent my creations at the International Convention Miss Fisher Murder Mysteries International Convention in June 2018 in the United States, in Portland, Oregon.

I need this flexible crowdfunding to achieve my different goals step by step.

Creating is all my life. I like to create every day. My grandmother gave me all her know-how as a sewing designer, her inspiration that she drew from everyday life and a very good knowledge of the years 20 -30.

My creations are inspired by icons of the time such as Louise Brooks, Clara Bow, creators like Jeanne Lanvin and Coco Chanel, but more recently television series such as the Miss Fisher, Downton Abbey, ....

I will honor my counterparts since the fundraising campaign is flexible, but I should limit my starting goals and review my priorities so that my company does not stop.

Then all my dreams will come true. And I can do so much more! I really do not lack of ideas!

Such as employing someone to help me in sewing, creating a collection of clothes and accessories even more important, making photos of my creations to include on my e-shop, organize an event on Paris gathering fans of those crazy years and art deco ... and still many other ideas that only want to be realized.

A huge thank you to:

Gwendoline for being a model,  Julien from Art d’Clic for his great pictures, Solyne, Morgan and her great illustrations, a beautiful source of inspiration Lorraine, my daughter Pauline, Lylou a little princess who adores my creations and last but not least my husband who believe in me ... and to all those who will allow me to continue this Great Story!

 

Version Française

UNE BELLE HISTOIRE...

Je suis Catherine, une femme passionnée par la vie et par la création, et surtout par l’époque 1900 à 1935.

Dans l’entre-deux-guerres, une génération nouvelle rêve d’un monde nouveau et proclame « Plus jamais ça ! ». Ces années, appelées les « Années Folles » ou les années 20, font jaillir une incroyable créativité dans tous les domaines : artistique, industriel, cinématographique... La mode et le design subliment le tragique de la Première Guerre Mondiale.

Cette page de l’Histoire me correspond. Cette résilience joyeuse et créatrice résonne en moi. A tel point que j’ai lancé en mars 2017 Les Créations de la Licorne pour ressusciter cet esprit.

Je chine et restaure des objets anciens : vieilles dentelles, meubles patinés, miroirs ternis, bijoux cabossés… tous ont une âme et racontent leur petite histoire dans la grande Histoire. Je crée, couds et confectionne. Bandeaux, chapeaux ou robes, plumes et perles, dentelles et broderies… je m’appuie sur mon talent créatif et l’héritage technique et artistique de ma grand-mère Louise. Couturière, elle m’a transmis sa passion, sa vision et son savoir-faire.

Aujourd’hui, je viens partager avec vous cet univers et cette inspiration joyeuse. Et j’ai besoin de vous, pour faire perdurer cette vision positive de l’histoire et du monde, et pour faire grandir mon entreprise

Aujourd’hui, je couds mes créations et restaure de vieux objets chinés sur un coin de table dans mon salon.

Je rêve d’ouvrir ma propre boutique pour y accueillir au mieux mes clients, pour exposer mes créations originales ainsi que la collection de meubles et objets de que j’ai chinés.

Ma boutique serait aussi mon atelier où je pourrais présenter les tissus, perles et plumes avec lesquels je travaille. Je pourrais coudre, broder, conseiller et former à cette époque très présente dans mon quotidien. Je pourrais réaliser des ateliers créatifs pour favoriser le travail de matières.

Pour développer mon activité, j’ai besoin de deux machines pour réaliser de la broderie Cornely pour enrichir mes créations de broderies. Métier que j’ai précédemment pratiqué et que ma mère peut toujours m’enseigner car elle était brodeuse Cornely et réalisait les 1ers modèles pour les plus grands couturiers comme Christian Lacroix.

J’ai besoin également d’une camionnette plutôt qu’une voiture pour pouvoir transporter tout mon matériel dans les différents salons et évènements auxquels je participe. J’en ai besoin aussi pour transporter les meubles que je chine pour les préparer et ensuite les livrer si besoin chez mes clients.

Petit à petit j’ai construit une clientèle qui achètent mes créations que ce soit robes de mariée, de soirée, headband et chapeaux, mais aussi les meubles que je restaure et patine. Je suis également devenue une référence en conseil de l’époque. Je réalise également des ateliers créatifs que j’espère pouvoir recevoir d’une meilleure façon dans mon atelier-boutique où en déplacement.

Récemment, une cliente m’a commandé une robe pour la montée des marches à Cannes. Un couple m’a commandé des meubles chinés pour décorer leur chambre d’hôtes. J’ai été par exemple invitée à représenter mes créations à la Convention Internationale Miss Fisher Murder Mysteries en juin 2018 aux États-Unis, à Portland dans l’Oregon.

J’ai besoin de ce financement participatif flexible pour atteindre mes différents objectifs les uns après les autres.

Créer est toute ma vie. J’aime créer tous les jours. Ma grand-mère m’a transmis tout son savoir-faire de couturière, son inspiration qu’elle tirait du quotidien et une très bonne connaissance des années 20-années 30.

Mes créations s’inspirent des icônes de l’époque comme Louise Brooks, Clara Bow, des créatrices comme Jeanne Lanvin et Coco Chanel, mais aussi plus récemment les séries télévisées comme les Enquêtes de Miss Fisher, Downton Abbey,.. .

J’honorerai mes contreparties puisque la campagne de financement est flexible, mais je devrais limiter mes objectifs de départ et revoir mes priorités pour ne pas que ma société s’arrête.

Alors tous mes rêves deviendront réalité. Et je pourrai faire tellement plus! Je ne manque vraiment pas d’idées ! Employer une personne pour m’aider dans la couture, créer une collection de vêtements et accessoires encore plus importants, faire des séances photos de mes créations à inclure sur ma e-boutique, organiser un évènement sur Paris rassemblant les fans de ces années folles et art déco… et encore plein d’autres idées qui ne demandent qu’à se réaliser.

Un immense Merci à :

Gwendoline pour avoir bien voulu poser pour moi, Julien de Art d’Clic pour ses clichés, à Solyne, à Morgan et ses illustrations, à une belle source d’inspiration Lorraine, ma fille Pauline, à Lylou une petite princesse qui adore mes créations et enfin mon homme qui croît en moi... et à toutes celles et ceux qui vont me permettre de continuer cette Belle Histoire !

What about the goals ? / Qu'en es-il de la répartition des objectifs?

The future workshop if I reach the crowdfunding goals

La future boutique - atelier si j'atteins l'objectif du financement participatif

This shop was built in the early 1900, with a pure Art Nouveau style. A lot of work to restore it inside and outside (paintings, flour, walls, back shop, access to wheel chair,...), that I will do on my own with the help of my husband. I will rent it.

Cette boutique fut construite au début du 20ème siècle, dans un pur style Art Nouveau. Énormément de travail à faire de rénovation à la fois à l'intérieur mais aussi à l'extérieur. Travaux que je ferai par moi-même et aidée de mon mari. Boutique que je louerai.

 

The perks / Les Contreparties

They are all unique, made especially for you ! Great material will be used, and as possible vintage ones.

Toutes les contreparties sont uniques créées pour vous ! De belles matières si possible de l'époque seront utilisées.

 

Other Ways You Can Help / D’autres Manières de Soutenir le Projet

I know it's not always possible to contribute financially, but that doesn't matter. You can make a huge difference to this by sharing it as far and wide as you can. Please use the indiegogo sharing tools to spread the message as much as you can.

Je sais que ce n’est pas toujours simple de contribuer financièrement, mais ce n’est rien, vous pouvez faire décoller le projet et atteindre les objectifs en partageant autour de vous et sur les réseaux sociaux. N’hésitez pas à utiliser les outils d’Indiegogo qui permettent de partager le projet et répandre la nouvelle autant que possible !

Vidéo présentant les Créations de la Licorne lors d'un évènement

 

Follow me :

Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/lescreationsdelalicorne/

Twitter : https://twitter.com/Catherine_Aubin

Instagram : https://www.instagram.com/les_creations_de_la_licorne/

Join the Roaring 20s Facebook Group / Rejoignez le groupe Années 20 :

https://www.facebook.com/groups/passionanneesfolles/

Je suis également devenue une référence en conseil de l’époque. Je réalise également des ateliers créatifs que j’espère pouvoir recevoir d’une meilleure façon dans mon atelier-boutique où en déplacement.Récemment, une cliente m’a commandé une robe pour la montée des marches à Cannes. Un couple m’a commandé des meubles chinés pour décorer leur chambre d’hôtes. J’ai été par exemple invitée à représenter mes créations à la Convention Internationale Miss Fisher Murder Mysteries en juin 2018 aux États-Unis, à Portland dans l’Oregon.J’ai besoin de ce financement participatif flexible pour atteindre mes différents objectifs les uns après les autres.Créer est toute ma vie. J’aime créer tous les jours. Ma grand-mère m’a transmis tout son savoir-faire de couturière, son inspiration qu’elle tirait du quotidien et une très bonne connaissance des années 20-années 30.Mes créations s’inspirent des icônes de l’époque comme Louise Brooks, Clara Bow, des créatrices comme Jeanne Lanvin et Coco Chanel, mais aussi plus récemment les séries télévisées comme les Enquêtes de Miss Fisher, Downton Abbey,.. .J’honorerai mes contreparties puisque la campagne de financement est flexible, mais je devrais limiter mes objectifs de départ et revoir mes priorités pour ne pas que ma société s’arrête.Alors tous mes rêves deviendront réalité. Et je pourrai faire tellement plus! Je ne manque vraiment pas d’idées ! Employer une personne pour m’aider dans la couture, créer une collection de vêtements et accessoires encore plus importants, faire des séances photos de mes créations à inclure sur ma e-boutique, organiser un évènement sur Paris rassemblant les fans de ces années folles et art déco… et encore plein d’autres idées qui ne demandent qu’à se réaliser.Un immense Merci à :Gwendoline pour avoir bien voulu poser pour moi, Julien de Art d’Clic pour ses clichés, à Solyne, à Morgan et ses illustrations, à une belle source d’inspiration Lorraine, ma fille Pauline, à Lylou une petite princesse qui adore mes créations et enfin mon homme qui croît en moi... et à toutes celles et ceux qui vont me permettre de continuer cette Belle Histoire !What about the goals ? / Qu'en es-il de la répartition des objectifs?The future workshop if I reach the crowdfunding goalsLa future boutique - atelier si j'atteins l'objectif du financement participatifThis shop was built in the early 1900, with a pure Art Nouveau style. A lot of work to restore it inside and outside (paintings, flour, walls, back shop, access to wheel chair,...), that I will do on my own with the help of my husband. I will rent it.Cette boutique fut construite au début du 20ème siècle, dans un pur style Art Nouveau. Énormément de travail à faire de rénovation à la fois à l'intérieur mais aussi à l'extérieur. Travaux que je ferai par moi-même et aidée de mon mari. Boutique que je louerai. The perks / Les ContrepartiesThey are all unique, made especially for you ! Great material will be used, and as possible vintage ones.Toutes les contreparties sont uniques créées pour vous ! De belles matières si possible de l'époque seront utilisées. Other Ways You Can Help / D’autres Manières de Soutenir le ProjetI know it's not always possible to contribute financially, but that doesn't matter. You can make a huge difference to this by sharing it as far and wide as you can. Please use the indiegogo sharing tools to spread the message as much as you can.Je sais que ce n’est pas toujours simple de contribuer financièrement, mais ce n’est rien, vous pouvez faire décoller le projet et atteindre les objectifs en partageant autour de vous et sur les réseaux sociaux. N’hésitez pas à utiliser les outils d’Indiegogo qui permettent de partager le projet et répandre la nouvelle autant que possible !Vidéo présentant les Créations de la Licorne lors d'un évènement Follow me :Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/lescreationsdelalicorne/Twitter : https://twitter.com/Catherine_AubinInstagram : https://www.instagram.com/les_creations_de_la_licorne/Join the Roaring 20s Facebook Group / Rejoignez le groupe Années 20 :https://www.facebook.com/groups/passionanneesfolles/

story:
My name is Abby Haukongo and I'm setting up this campaign to help 9 children in Swakopmund, Namibia  who are about to lose their home.


We urgently need funds in the amount of $6,000 to ensure that the children have a roof over their head. The $300 is included to pay Indiegogo their 5% fee for using the platform.

We are currently in the process of being evicted as no funds have been forthcoming from our fundraising initiatives. Securing funds for RENT and basic necessities, is an uphill battle. One that is slowly taking it's toll on both the children and their caregivers.

This is the seventh time in the space of ten years, that we have to move. We do not have the funds to move and cannot afford a more expensive house to rent. This place we live in is the cheapest we could find. The children have not known the joy of a permanent home, as there's always been the ever nagging thought in the back of their minds: "How long before we have to move again".

By helping us raise $6,000 you will help us pay outstanding rent money which we owe the landlord from the beginning of this year till now, as well as ensure that our rent is paid for till the end of this year.

By helping us raise this money you will ensure that the children would not have to go through the traumatic experience of having to move yet again, leaving friends and familiar surroundings behind.


What We Ask & What You Get

Here is a breakdown of what the money will be used for:

We currently pay N$8,000 a month for rent.

This would amount to N$ 96,000 per year for rent.

We've paid only N$ 18,000 for the year,

Which leaves N$ 78,000 outstanding for the year.

At the current exchange rate of roughly N$13 : 1USD we would be able to pay this amount and ensure that the children have a peaceful festive season.

This amounts to exactly $6,000

Should we not reach our goal with this campaign, we will use all monies collected in the payment of the outstanding rent amount.

What we can offer you for your help

For donations of $25 - We will send you a handwritten personalized letter from the children as well as a photo to thank you for your donation.

For donations of $100 - We will send you an engraved makalani nut keyholder. The makalani nut grows only in the northern parts of Namibia.


For larger donations ($300 up) - We will send you a personalized video from the children thanking you for your generous gift.


The Impact

We are appealing to everyone who sees this to please share as far and as wide as you can. What might seem like a little insignificant action on your part will mean the world to a child in need.

This home is not run by an organization but by two women who depend on the kindness of others.

Running the home costs about $16,000 a year. This includes rent, food, water and electricity and other basic expenses, but excludes things like clothing, homeschooling necessities and fees for extracurricular activities for all 9 children.

Here is a basic layout:

Per month -     Rent         N$ 8,000.00

                            Food         N$6,000.00

                            W&E         N$3,000.00

Total                                    N$17,000.00           

Subtotal       USD  (exchange rate of 13 to the dollar)            $1,350 /month    

an extra $400 /month would help cover for things like fuel, car maintenance, medicine, clothing, extracurricular activities like extra lessons, fun outings, school excursions, school necessities and cosmetics.  Which would bring the total monthly expenditures to:

Subtotal  USD  (exchange rate of 13 to the dollar)                $1,750/month   or

                                                      $21,000 per year

A big chunk of the money goes towards rent, and we would like to eliminate that. Our immediate future goals include coming back to this platform as soon as possible to raise funds for the acquisition of a piece of land.
We are currently looking at a smallholding outside of Swakopmund, as it is big enough to build a big house, as well as plant crops and keep animals. Please contact us if you would like more information in that regard.

Other Ways You Can Help

####  You May Contact Me - Please Do (the link is in the Team Members box above) if you would like to donate via an alternative method e.g. cash, cheque, paypal etc. All donations will then be posted on to this site by us so you know your money has gone to the right place. Thank you. ####

If you want to do more:

  • Get the word out via your Social Media platforms like Facebook, Twitter, wherever you socialize!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
End Malaria Now is raising an additional $25,000 to get us to Kenya February 2016 to distribute 10,000 mosquito nets!!! We need your help to get us there!!! 

Malaria is the number one killer of children in Africa. Over half a million children under the age of 5 die from Malaria every year; that’s one child dying every 60 seconds. 

Our End Malaria Now team will be going to Africa in February 2016 to hand deliver 10,000 mosquito bed nets to the villages in immediate need, educate them on the prevention of malaria and to demonstrate the proper use of these bed nets.

End Malaria Now has distributed over 50,000 bed nets since 2009, please help us distribute 10,000 MORE this February 2016!!! 

A race to save as many lives as we can is happening now and we must ACT FAST! A simple mosquito bed net has the ability to help prevent the transmission of malaria and thus SAVE LIVES!!! 

While the goal to get us closer to the malaria-free world we dream of is high, the price of inaction is even higher. 

Please support our cause and help make ending malaria deaths our generation’s greatest humanitarian triumph! 

Remember that your donation is tax-deductible!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Local Perspectives, Global Readership

We at The Typewriter hope to address two main problems facing news media and social media today.

First problem: Misrepresentation

Simply put, we ask these questions: 

  • In this day and age of the 24-hour international news cycle, what gives an American, British or Australian journalist the expertise to report on what’s actually happening on the ground in the Middle East, Asia, Africa, or vice versa? 
  • What is the point of news media if their method of portrayal is solely tailored to tell a story which fits the tastes, style and rhetoric of a home audience thousands of miles away?

We notice that there is a substantive disconnect between what is happening in certain countries, what is being said by those who live in these countries, and what is being reported by international news media. 

Eventually, misrepresentation will lead to a decline of confidence in the news at large. People will stop reading and those who are being misrepresented will stop caring.

Second problem: Sensationalism

In recent years, as the internet is being ‘democratised’, anonymity and the chase for high click engagements have fuelled more articles, comments, posts or tweets which are catchy, trendy, controversial or offensive. The internet nowadays lack a decorum of respect and reserve. 

As a result, publishers try their best in being ‘trendy’ by tailoring their articles to the lowest common denominator of humanity. Eventually, many moderate readers become fed up with the media in general, due to the presence of loud, tasteless and nonsensical content.

We are not trying to filter or censor content or opinion. We believe that everyone deserves a voice and everyone should be given a platform to express their concerns. However, we also believe that opinions will be better understood if the tone, manner, language and delivery of the ideas are less sensationalist in general. 

Enter our website here


Our mission: Reverse these trends

We believe that the best way to do so is to invite and empower those who are on the ground to tell their own stories themselves. As such, The Typewriter provides a media platform for anyone to write an article via our website or our mirroring mobile app.

In order to publish quality content whilst empowering those who are not confident in writing eloquently, we have an internal editing system which connects writers and editors. 

They can track the changes made to an article and they can work with each other so that the writers’ words will not be misread or misunderstood. With the editorial support provided by our dedicated team of editors, we reduce misrepresentation and sensationalism in the media. Just like an actual typewriter, we become a tool to encourage better communication between individuals and across cultures.  

Awards and Recognition

United Nations: 

  • We've been recognised as a youth organisation and we have been regularly invited to attend meetings on the Youth. 

Interviews:

  • Our brand and our principles have given us the credibility to reach out to public figures. Our most recent interviews include a former Foreign Minister of Bosnia and Herzegovina, a former Australian Prime Minister, a former British Member of Parliament, a Partner of KPMG and award winning film directors.

     


PITCH Competition:

  • At this year's RISE Conference (a tech x startup conference in Hong Kong), The Typewriter entered the PITCH competition and ended up a Semi-Finalist after competing with over 300 companies. 

E-Squared Competition:

  • At this year's Hong Kong IT Fest, The Typewriter entered the E-squared Competition and won the Most Popular Pitch Award for Social innovation x Tech Innovation. 


Mentions in the Press: 

  • Our efforts are mentioned in an array of independent media sites, noting our effort in reaching out to a smarter audience by providing articles which are only written by those who are on the ground. Latest interviews of The Typewriter are found in StartUp Daily and Periodismoncidadano (Spanish Citizen Journalism)

How does The Typewriter work?

  1. Firstly, you enter the website and click “tell us your story”. You do not have to be a journalist or a literacy genius. Anyone can write. As long as you write about your surroundings and from your own perspective, we will help you in getting your work published. 

  2. Secondly, once your article is submitted. An editor will contact you and work with you in fact- checking, translating, polishing and editing the article. We will provide you with all the support you need to make your article look legitimate, and this in turn will increase the chances in getting your voices heard. You will also receive auto messages whenever changes are made to your article, so that you can keep track of the process. 
  3. Finally, as long as your thoughts are not offensive, as long as you only write about your locality, we will publish your article on our website, they will appear on our social media feeds, and as we are currently accredited by Google News as a legitimate news source, our articles will also appear on the Google News feed as well. 

Readership 

Since we started the website back in 2013 when I was still a university student, our readership and the number of our writers have grown steadily. Currently, we have over 5 million unique visitors from all around the world, with a monthly average view rate of 800,000.

Most of them are university students, graduates or young professionals. General feedback we have received so far from our readers are quite positive, stressing the need for quality and genuine content in the world and that not everyone wants to read easy click-bait oriented content. 

Moreover, our website is currently in four languages (English, Chinese, French and German) and we will be branching out to Spanish and Arabic later this year. We realised that in order to maximise our readership and to foster a stronger community in global communications and media, we simply cannot only pay attention to English speakers. From now on, whenever a person writes an article in his/her mother tongue, it will be cross-translated by our affiliate language teams.


Our Goals

  1. Making the world a better place
  2. A more civilised news media 
  3. Encouraging REAL communication 
  4. Promote REAL global citizenship 

It is common knowledge that it is often most difficult to start an independent news media channels. People would say that there is no way you can compete with the established media. 

So that is why we need your help. We believe that, considering our growing support and readership, we can survive and we will make the world more civilised. But we need your support as well.

The funds raised will be used to look for aspiring young talents in all corners of the world and start reporting what's happening on the ground. We will use our funds wisely to fund our editors, artists and photographers who are working voluntarily. 

Our long-term plan is to have multiple languages on our site, an online channel, a quicker editing system and coverage everywhere. This will need substantial funds to find talents, fund equipments and work with local organisations.

So that is why we need your help. We believe that, considering our growing support and readership, we can survive and we will make the world more civilised. But we need your support as well. The funds raised will be used to look for aspiring young talents in all corners of the world and start reporting what's happening on the ground. We will use our funds wisely to fund our editors, artists and photographers who are working voluntarily. 
Our long-term plan is to have multiple languages on our site, an online channel, a quicker editing system and coverage everywhere. This will need substantial funds to find talents, fund equipments and work with local organisations.

story:
HEY EVERYONE!! PLEASE HELP US EXPAND!!! We want to offer an online ordering source to our customers. We want to offer the ordering and  delivery for the restaurants we work with. This will allow them to compete with the larger chains in the area on a more level playing field. We have been working with local residents and restaurants for close to two years using a call in style delivery service.picking up prescriptions and groceries Ect. Our services are for our customers that do not have the ability to offer online ordering and delivery for their own product. This product will enable Local Nashua and surrounding areas  residents the ability to order food from there favorite restaurants and have it delivered to there door in a timely manner. This expansion will enable us to become the company we envisioned when we first started this awesome ride we're on! I (the owner) have been in the restaurant business since I could work. I have over 20 years experience in the food services and delivery industry which has helped me get to where i am now.  I really appreciate your time and thank you for your support

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Every project has its risks and challenges to overcome. As far as foreseen issues, we feel very confident in our ability to quickly and competently overcome  obstacles. Our major risk and challenge is being able to prepare and deliver our Product in a short period of time while maintaining the timeline we have set for ourselves to achieve our benchmarks and goals.We have already proven we can be successful with the call in style ordering platform and would like the opportunity to be a complete success in all aspects of the delivery services platform and to complete or expansion

That blossomed into a life long career as a delivery expert! We have been in business In Nashua N.H. since 2013 and have had some great successes. We currently have a great foundation of LOCAL  companies we are working with. We have been working as hard as we can and are almost to the finish line of our expansion!! We are a FAMILY owned and operated company and can't wait to make our company family bigger!:) THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIMEl:) HEY EVERYONE!! PLEASE HELP US EXPAND!!! story:
My name is Jonathon Lunardi and I am an entrepreneur and dad of two in the Washington DC Metro area. I specialize in developing Internet websites, apps and businesses to support and serve the US Military veterans and their families of this great country. I am the CEO and I lead a tremendous force of co-founders, staff, contractors, family members, and partners from around the world. It is a privilege to serve veterans in their struggles to recover from the war’s wounds.

This campaign is about putting a STOP to Veteran struggles by empowering them to network with each other better, to serve each other better, and to use the Military camaraderie that they love to find better paths as civilians in America.


What is 'ServingVETS'?

ServingVETS gives veterans a support platform based on peer recommendations of local resources. The platform is currently deployed on the web as well as the Apple iTunes market. Find us at www.servingvets.com.  @servingvets #veterans 

ServingVETS 2.0:  The money raised will go to develop and market this platform.


With the money raised through this campaign we will be able to build a new ServingVETS 2.0 with new and improved features, get the platform out to the world, and extend the reach to all Android, Windows 10, and Amazon devices (as well iOS and the web which we have already accomplished with the first version of the platform). SV 2.0 enables:

1. View member reviews and their activity updates

2. Add photos, videos, emojis and drawings

3. Use on both tablets and mobile devices

4. Advanced privacy controls and security settings

5. Ability to see another veterans location if enabled

Watch the below video to see Jonathon and his son encourage press and the media to contact us about ServingVETS and veteran support in general.


What is 'ServingVETS' - Learn More....

ServingVETS verifies, connects, and matches veterans together based on their unique profile traits and their unique privacy settings. It is free for anyone to use to read ratings/reviews from verified veterans, however only US Military veterans are allowed to create an account and post ratings/reviews. Through veteran verification we are creating a platform of trusted online resources supporting US veterans and their families across the world.  

Veterans will be able to set their privacy for a unique radar that only other Veterans could use. All information and documentation will also be stored in a very secure way so that Veterans in need can open up in a non-intimidating space. This would be an online space only available to other veterans, making it a safe and supportive platform to use.


Our vision is to let the veteran closely control the privacy of their posts and enable them to send posts to groups of veterans they create (in a similar way to Google circles). Then, a veteran can organize their followers into categories based on trust and privacy.


Press Release and Press Mentions:

ServingVETS has an official press release, the link is here - http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/dc-area-internet-entrepreneur-launches-servingvets-an-exclusive-and-secure-social-network-for-veterans-300176730.html 

We were picked up in Tech.co, which is what Tech Cocktail used to be.


Tech.co official link - http://tech.co/servingvets-launches-crowdfunding-campaign-expands-features-2015-11 


Who Runs 'ServingVETS'?

The amazing team bringing you ServingVETS is run by seasoned CEO and proven startup leader, Jonathon Lunardi. This campaign is critical because America's veterans need help and they are all connected by their phones, tablets, and other devices. There are too many suicides each day, too many homeless, so many confused, and waiting in long lines for far too long.  The ServingVETS team is made up of doers who use technology to empower a veteran grassroots movement to support veteran care of the future.

Jonathon has been in Washington DC for 15 years. He grew up in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma and went to the University of Oklahoma where he ran the Sooner Information Network. He was born in Houston, Texas.  Jonathon is an extremely resourceful, well-networked civilian.

Jonathon worked at Blackboard Inc. for five years and led the Community Engagement portal for the company, supporting millions of students, faculty, and staff each day.  Jonathon is uniquely qualified to network veterans together online to positively impact those who are suffering in a scalable way.

Paul Day is the CTO and chief programmer of the platform.  Paul runs the entire platform from PHP and we have invested thousands of hours into the code.  Paul is from Maryland and worked in many government and academic tech industries.


Wade Howard is head of client relations.  Wade is a former US Army officer and worked with Jonathon at Blackboard within education software sales.  Wade is a solutions engineer for veteran success in the classroom and around a university ecosystem.  Wade is from Texas A&M and lives in Austin, TX.

Pamela Hart Vines runs public relations for ServingVETS.  She is the CEO of TroopPR.com and served in the US Army public affairs department for 15 years.  Pamela knows the Military community better than anyone in the PR industry.  She is located in DC where she can work closely with Jonathon to ensure ServingVETS meets is press potential.

Link to our Press Release - http://www.servingvets.com/press/veteransday.pdf

Karen Herson, Advisor to ServingVETS.  Karen is the CEO of Concepts Communications Inc.  Concepts is a MD firm that runs Disability.gov and has been helping the Department of Labor solve disability problems for over 19 years.  Karen and her team of communication professionals are leaders in US government disability best practices.  

Why you should back the 'ServingVETS' campaign:

  • Member First access - You will get first access to all future apps released for ServingVETS.  You will be able to provide feedback to our tech team to mold the platform for all others who join after you.
  • Veteran peer to peer support - You will know that Veterans everywhere will be uniting through this technology to share opinions and record their voices.
  • Virtual memorial - You receive the option to send us a photo of a soldier or veteran that they know, and we will post that on our site, and rotate it throughout the platform.  See below for example.  You can send us a photo, a quote, and choose a background image and we will create a custom virtual memorial page and banner for the veteran you choose.

  • Investment opportunity - You get news of our financial announcements first, which includes future selling of equity via crowdfunding.
  • Our Jobs - You know about our jobs leads.  All of our jobs and work for 1099 contractors and full-time employees are first announced to our contributors of this campaign.      
  • Prizes and contests - We will offer unique contests and gifts to the contributors of this campaign.  You might receive stickers, t-shirts, hats, computers, gift cards, new cars, or whatever our sponsors give us to give to our contributors.

Become a Contributor Today!  There is a price point for everyone!

Perfect Holiday gift idea!  

The Perks:

For Veterans & Contributors:

  1. $5 - Virtual coin on unique coin memorial page
  2. $19 - Virtual brick memorial within platform
  3. $29 - Veteran VIP Membership
  4. $29 - Sponsor a Veteran Member 
  5. $39 - Veteran Spouses and Family Membership
  6. $39 - Swag Bag Grab Bag - Junior
  7. $59 - Veteran Civilian Advocate Membership
  8. $79 - VIP Swag Bag Grab Bag - Adult 

For Businesses & Education Institutions: 

  1. $99 - Small Business 1 year subscription
  2. $479 - Education Institution 2 year subscription
  3. $899 - Large company 1 year subscription
  4. $1599  Sponsor us and be a part of the journey

How is the Money used?

The money raised will primarily go towards development costs of the programming and design of the apps and marketing / promotion of the platform around the world for a sustained period of time of at least 9 months.  Some of the proceeds will go toward legal costs to protect IP regarding how and why we recommend content to veterans and properly trademarking the brand.  

Money is used to drive revenues through outreach efforts to schools and businesses who are serving veterans.  The ServingVETS platform enables them to serve their local veteran communities better.  


What Happens if We Don't Reach $100,000?

Don't Worry! We are committed to putting in the sweat equity to fill all perks that are bought, regardless of the goal. However much we do raise, no matter how small, we are still going to continue with the development of SupportingVETS 2.0, and we will honor all perks purchased through the campaign page (it may just take a longer to fulfil everything).  $100,000 is an important goal for this campaign as it will enable us to continue development, give us marketing fuel to put the company on a strong financial foundation, and allow us to have the platform available to the veterans and their families of the United States of America sooner rather than later.

This campaign is about giving you an opportunity to show Veterans that you truly do support them by doing something instead of simply saying ‘Thank You’.  Backing this campaign or sharing it with others positively impacts your local Veteran community with unique, innovative tools and services built by the ServingVETS.com platform. Think of us as the Google or Facebook for Veterans, focused on connecting Veterans together to solve their problems and recover faster from their wounds than ever before.

We are America, we are inventors, we are pioneers, we are entrepreneurs who develop innovations to solve any problem, no matter how daunting.  ServingVETS is aimed at doing that for the many diverse problems and pain that is caused from being a part of the longest war in history of America, Iraq and Afghanistan.  


America is one of the greatest nations on the planet because of the US Military protecting its freedom, pursuit of liberty, and justice for all people.  By backing this project or sharing the campaign with others, you are Serving US Military Veterans.

Be a part of the solution, help fund our project, and support ServingVETS.com today!

Overcoming Challenges

First off, there is no challenge that Jonathon and his team cannot handle. We eat challenges for breakfast, lunch dinner. If there is not a challenge in front of us, something is wrong and too quiet so it is a time to pause and listen.  Every day is about jumping hurdles and moving forward. We grow stronger because of our proven ability to run through challenges day in and day out. We balance family, work, spirit, and exercise to an Art. Everything is challenging, it just depends on how you are mentally and physically prepared to face life's ups and downs.  

Jonathon plays Ultimate Frisbee at least once a week and jogs two to three times a week.  He also has two young boys who run more than wild gazelles.


Our Partners:

ID.me - www.id.me

University of Nevada, Las Vegas UNLV Student Veterans Department - www.unlv.edu 

Social Radar and LocationKit - www.socialradar.com

International Culinary Center - www.icc.edu

University of Oklahoma Student Veterans Club

story:
Short Summary

In 2008, I began working for a company that pioneered the mainstream "handmade" bath and body care movement.  That experience changed my way of thinking about what I was putting on, and in my body.  Body care, as it were, should be just that- Caring for your body.  It was after my employ with that company that my mind was set on doing it too- but doing it better.  
In 2009, I produced my first soaps and lotions for a line in a lingerie boutique I co-owned.  When certain lotions would be released, they would be sold out before they hit the shelves.  People heard about us, and my ideas became a reliable alternative to the larger company that hadn't been so transparent with its ingredients.
Flash forward a few years, and I decided to put more focus on this dream.  Creation and care-  Creation of a better product for you, and caring enough about the consumer's wallet to not break the bank.
Once again, as soon as a product is announced, it is sold before it hits the shelves.  As with our hand batched cold-process soaps, sometimes it's sold before it even hits the curing racks.

This is a good problem, but the requirements that are needed to make this project grow are time, money, and space.  I'll explain more below.

What We Need & What You Get

The first phase: Incorporation and licenses- $2,000
The facts:  In order for The Salty Wench to go from home craft to legitimate business, we need to file as a corporate entity. 

Second:   Equipment- $10,000
The facts:  This is a handmade company, but a small amount of machinery can help us keep costs down, and production consistent.
What we need:
-1 Hydraulic Bath Bomb Press: $800
-1 Air Compressor for the Press: $100
-5 Die for the press: at $100 each= $500
-----
-1 Kitchenaid Proline Series 7qt Mixer- $699
-2 7qt flex edge beater attachment- $59.99ea = $120
-5 5qt Stainless Bowls (mixer specific)- $80ea= $400
-2 Elliptical Whip attachments- $59.99ea= $120
-1 Immersion Blender (Medium Duty) =$160
-----
- 10 Silicone Loaf Molds and Wooden Boxes $20ea- $200
- Misc Soap Molds- Various shapes and designs- $200
- 1 Soap Cutter Box- $40
- 8 2qt glass batter bowls- $110
-----
-1 Primera LX label printer, extra ink, various size and shape labels- $4000
(To print our own labels for products in-house.  This allows individual labeling for custom work and small batch labels)
-----
- 60 Drying Trays- $1500
-4 Tray dollies- $270
-Misc spoons, spatulas, plastic measuring cups, mixing bins, etc- $800

Third: Supplies- Ingredients $20,000
In order to keep costs low, bulk ordering is required.  Pricing for this portion can be broken down further, however, more or less of each ingredient may be needed to meet demand. There are literally hundreds of ingredients to stock.  Oils and such are ordered by barrels and drums to keep costs lowest.

Fourth:  Build Out Workshop- $8,000
-Shelving, sinks, climate control, work tables, Organization.

Fifth: Marketing- $10,000
-Website revamp and build out
-Printed Materials

Sixth: Help!- $60,000
Plain and simple- funds to secure employees to help production



Stretch Goals:  Secure Retail Location- $200,000
Estimation for average rent: $5000/mo- $60,000/yr x 3=$180,000
Utilities:$500/mo= $6,000/year=  $18,000 3 years
Overestimation- $2,000

Stretch Goals: Build Out- $300,000
Imagine a beautiful, bright storefront welcoming you in with seductive scents, soothing music.  All your bath and skincare needs are met here.  Not only can you find the soaps and skincare that you expect and love, but gifts that compliment the luxury lover.  Elegant nighties for her, plush robes for him and her, towels and all manner of bath acoutrement- embroidered for you at your request.  All elegantly gift boxed and wrapped for you upon request.

Have a romantic date planned?  Our selection of sparkling wines and champagnes and champagne flutes add the finishing touches to the full luxury experience.

If by some odd chance you can't find what you like, we offer gift certificates to cover every offering at the store.

Hands On You:

A masseuse and hairstylist are on hand to give you the royal treatment using our premium spa line- "Salt"  
Massage takes place in a private, and gorgeously appointed room infused with essential oils and the sound of gently cascading water from our exotic fish tank.

More about the environment:
-Clean, white lines accented with sea glass mosaic.  Ambient music echoes from every corner.
-There is a sink bar where every single product can be tested individually.  5 mirrored sinks- similar to the layout of a sushi bar- where the specialist can serve up samples and describe the benefit of each product.  (This comes in handy for private parties and themed skincare events as well)
-There is a section specifically male-targeted.  Darker feel, yet still inviting.
-There is a shave sink and mirror where a man can get his hair trimmed as well as an old-fashioned shave in our antique barber chair.  (Using Salty Wench's shave butter of course!)
-Fresh face masks are available for purchase by ordering from the "menu"
-There are lounge chairs and a sitting area. 
- Every detail is by design- down to the bubble chandeliers adorning the textured ceilings.
-Multiple events, lessons, hands on- as well as charitable events such as pamper day for moms, Cancer survivor, mommy and me spa days, etc.

The Impact

There is currently very little mainstream competition in this caliber of luxury and handmade bath product.  We also strive to be more affordable than the rest- putting us in a league of our own entirely.

As for the conceptual retail location, there is nothing in the current marketplace that can compare to our business model.

  • Fresh, handmade luxury
  • More reasonable pricing
  • Solid, loyal fan base
  • Unique, multi-faceted experience


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Thank you for your support!
story_txt:
Short Summary In 2008, I began working for a company that pioneered the mainstream "handmade" bath and body care movement.  That experience changed my way of thinking about what I was putting on, and in my body.  Body care, as it were, should be just that- Caring for your body.  It was after my employ with that company that my mind was set on doing it too- but doing it better.  In 2009, I produced my first soaps and lotions for a line in a lingerie boutique I co-owned.  When certain lotions would be released, they would be sold out before they hit the shelves.  People heard about us, and my ideas became a reliable alternative to the larger company that hadn't been so transparent with its ingredients.Flash forward a few years, and I decided to put more focus on this dream.  Creation and care-  Creation of a better product for you, and caring enough about the consumer's wallet to not break the bank.Once again, as soon as a product is announced, it is sold before it hits the shelves.  As with our hand batched cold-process soaps, sometimes it's sold before it even hits the curing racks.This is a good problem, but the requirements that are needed to make this project grow are time, money, and space.  I'll explain more below.   What We Need & What You Get
 The first phase: Incorporation and licenses- $2,000The facts:  In order for The Salty Wench to go from home craft to legitimate business, we need to file as a corporate entity. Second:   Equipment- $10,000The facts:  This is a handmade company, but a small amount of machinery can help us keep costs down, and production consistent.What we need:-1 Hydraulic Bath Bomb Press: $800-1 Air Compressor for the Press: $100-5 Die for the press: at $100 each= $500------1 Kitchenaid Proline Series 7qt Mixer- $699-2 7qt flex edge beater attachment- $59.99ea = $120-5 5qt Stainless Bowls (mixer specific)- $80ea= $400-2 Elliptical Whip attachments- $59.99ea= $120-1 Immersion Blender (Medium Duty) =$160------ 10 Silicone Loaf Molds and Wooden Boxes $20ea- $200- Misc Soap Molds- Various shapes and designs- $200- 1 Soap Cutter Box- $40- 8 2qt glass batter bowls- $110------1 Primera LX label printer, extra ink, various size and shape labels- $4000(To print our own labels for products in-house.  This allows individual labeling for custom work and small batch labels)------ 60 Drying Trays- $1500-4 Tray dollies- $270-Misc spoons, spatulas, plastic measuring cups, mixing bins, etc- $800Third: Supplies- Ingredients $20,000In order to keep costs low, bulk ordering is required.  Pricing for this portion can be broken down further, however, more or less of each ingredient may be needed to meet demand. There are literally hundreds of ingredients to stock.  Oils and such are ordered by barrels and drums to keep costs lowest.Fourth:  Build Out Workshop- $8,000-Shelving, sinks, climate control, work tables, Organization.Fifth: Marketing- $10,000-Website revamp and build out-Printed MaterialsSixth: Help!- $60,000Plain and simple- funds to secure employees to help productionStretch Goals:  Secure Retail Location- $200,000Estimation for average rent: $5000/mo- $60,000/yr x 3=$180,000Utilities:$500/mo= $6,000/year=  $18,000 3 yearsOverestimation- $2,000Stretch Goals: Build Out- $300,000Imagine a beautiful, bright storefront welcoming you in with seductive scents, soothing music.  All your bath and skincare needs are met here.  Not only can you find the soaps and skincare that you expect and love, but gifts that compliment the luxury lover.  Elegant nighties for her, plush robes for him and her, towels and all manner of bath acoutrement- embroidered for you at your request.  All elegantly gift boxed and wrapped for you upon request.Have a romantic date planned?  Our selection of sparkling wines and champagnes and champagne flutes add the finishing touches to the full luxury experience.If by some odd chance you can't find what you like, we offer gift certificates to cover every offering at the store.Hands On You:A masseuse and hairstylist are on hand to give you the royal treatment using our premium spa line- "Salt"  Massage takes place in a private, and gorgeously appointed room infused with essential oils and the sound of gently cascading water from our exotic fish tank.More about the environment:-Clean, white lines accented with sea glass mosaic.  Ambient music echoes from every corner.-There is a sink bar where every single product can be tested individually.  5 mirrored sinks- similar to the layout of a sushi bar- where the specialist can serve up samples and describe the benefit of each product.  (This comes in handy for private parties and themed skincare events as well)-There is a section specifically male-targeted.  Darker feel, yet still inviting.-There is a shave sink and mirror where a man can get his hair trimmed as well as an old-fashioned shave in our antique barber chair.  (Using Salty Wench's shave butter of course!)-Fresh face masks are available for purchase by ordering from the "menu"-There are lounge chairs and a sitting area. - Every detail is by design- down to the bubble chandeliers adorning the textured ceilings.-Multiple events, lessons, hands on- as well as charitable events such as pamper day for moms, Cancer survivor, mommy and me spa days, etc.
    The Impact There is currently very little mainstream competition in this caliber of luxury and handmade bath product.  We also strive to be more affordable than the rest- putting us in a league of our own entirely.As for the conceptual retail location, there is nothing in the current marketplace that can compare to our business model.  Fresh, handmade luxury
More reasonable pricing Solid, loyal fan base
Unique, multi-faceted experience




    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.   Thank you for your support!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Maya Gouliard, owner of Golden Glow Games in Rantoul, Illinois. We have been open for 5 months now and have successfully reached all of our start up goals. 

  • I am a current University of Illinois Masters student in the Recreation, Sport and Tourism department. I have past experience helping to manage a game store (Master Consignment in Urbana, Illinois about 10 years ago). I have years of experience with running social media for parent groups, along with a multitude of different jobs focusing on customer service. 
  • My long term goals for Golden Glow Games are grand, from the eventual addition of a cafe area and expand into comic and sci-fi/fantasy memorabilia. But first we need to get this business in full swing, and that is the purpose of this campaign.
  • Help from all of you - from $5 to $500 will help us secure the success and longevity that I know this business can achieve.

What We Need & What You Get

Not only will you be helping to secure the stores long term ability to stay in business, but you will get some awesome perks:

  • We started with the bare minimums. For those of you who visited our store in the first few weeks you will remember our 3 sleeves of Magic singles and one sleeve of YuGiOh singles. We have come a long way! But each week I make tough decisions about what to add to the inventory based on our funds for the orders. I want to get us past this issue. With an influx of capital we can bring in the base inventory we need and focus on ordering replacements and new releases.
  • In exchange for your support we have some great Golden Glow Games bling. From a custom Maxx the Dragon d6, to an adorable enamel pin, to a rocking Golden Glow Games t-shirt or sweatshirt. You will be able to style your support of the store!
  • Even if we don't reach our goal, each bit will help. The inventory has grown, and this will be the shot in the arm it needs to get to the level we all want. 

The Impact

Golden Glow Games is a great community space, where all ages and experience levels have been able to interact, learn and have fun. We have taught many how to play games they had not heard of before, and have made many new friends. Tabletop gaming is my passion, from RPG's to trading card games, to board games, I love the personal interaction that these strategy games bring.  The goal is to reach more of the community and bring more of the gamers looking for a personal connection to our store.

Risks & Challenges

I took a huge risk opening this store with minimal capital. With the support of a few wonderful people and a lot of hard work from myself and my family we got this business off and running. All businesses take time to grow and throw challenges at you. I am excited to face these. I can't wait to see what the next six months send our way. Hopefully more new friends and fun times.

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Whether you are interested in an adorable t-shirt or not you can help by spreading the word.
  • Remember that Indiegogo has some amazingly easy share tools!

Thank you all!

story:
Our Story

Hi!  We are Jreh & Christine Hurst, late-bloomer small business owners.  We are longtime residents of Park Slope, Brooklyn. We've been married 10 years and have a 6 year old son, Julian.

Born in Park Slope, Jreh became a Certified Personal Trainer at the age of 37 and Christine became a Certified Health Coach shortly thereafter.

We both arrived at our present passions due to personal experience with weight loss and are committed to helping others recognize their health potential within the community we know and love. You can say that we are, “all in”!

For our full background, here is a link to BKLYNER, a local blog that featured us on their site.

We've always wanted to own our own business and decided to pursue our dream in 2017 when we opened the physical location of, BK Fitness Center.

In 2016, Jreh secured a large, raw, industrial storefront at the intersection of three up-and-coming Brooklyn neighborhoods: South Slope, Greenwood and Gowanus. 

Jreh worked fast to design the gym layout, procure equipment and build out the space. Most of our cash was spent on equipment, tools and rent deposits.

Our first eight months have been a whirlwind of learning, growing, hard work and hustle. We work day and night at our gym. We both clean toilets, stock towels and check people in. No job is too small. Jreh does all the training/coaching as well as teaches classes while I work behind the scenes doing marketing and health coaching while maintaining a full time job that pays our house bills. 

We LOVE the business we have worked so hard to build and are blown away by the support we have received from the neighborhood. We are so thankful when someone chooses to spend their hard-earned money to join our gym. That reason alone is why we dedicate so much of ourselves in investing in our member's health and fitness. We WANT our members to come and get healthy and fit.  It also means the world to us to have the opportunity of running our business within the community we live.

Check out what our clients and members have to say:

Yelp:  https://www.yelp.com/biz/bk-fitness-center-broo...

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/bkfitnesscenter/

Google: http://bit.ly/2xScY9c

Classpass: https://classpass.com/studios/bk-fitness-center-brooklyn#ratings

By helping us achieve our goals, you can have a hand in not only ensuring this amazing process continues, but helping to create something with an even larger and more sustainable impact in the long term and in our community. 

We are at a critical point where we need help to raise capital to take BK Fitness Center to the next level.
 

As many of you know, rents in our area are very high. While we have achieved much success over the last eight months, we are still operating at a deficit. We are open to investors/partners (if anyone knows of any potential investors, please send them our way. We have an Investor Presentation & Business Plan).

Since we've never been the types to ask for help, preferring to focus on work and community collaborations, it was a difficult choice for us to do this campaign.  It was ultimately a few loyal customers who gave us the inspiration to share our story and go the crowd-funding route. So many have shared that they can't imagine us leaving, and neither can we. 

What We Need:

STAFFING:

While we both have intense work ethics and relish control over small details, we really need to hire staff to increase revenue. By hiring an experienced fitness professional to drive sales and close deals,  we can focus on delivering a premium fitness experience to our clients. 

With the expansion of our bootcamp class membership, we need another fitness trainer to teach classes so that we can offer more classes during peak hours.

MARKETING / ADVERTISING:

We’ve done a good job with a low marketing spend and word of mouth/organic growth, but we need to ramp up efforts to attract more members & clients. Advertising is key to get the word out and compete with the marketing budgets of the corporate gyms and franchises that have sprouted up in our neighborhood.

DAY TO DAY EXPENSES:

We are still operating at a deficit, but slowly and surely our growth trajectory has been consistent, month over month. With your contribution, we will be able to cover the shortfall and focus our energy on delivering a great experience, marketing and improving our space/purchasing new equipment.

EQUIPMENT/SPACE UPGRADES:

We would like to purchase some great new fitness tools for our members and to attract potential members.  We'd also like to paint and upgrade the general space

EXPANSION:

An exciting part of this process is the launch of our program, BK FitKids. As parents to a young child, we know the importance of movement, strength and flexibility. We want to be on the front lines of improving and maintaining our children’s health and well-being, which is why we are super excited about the next phase of BK Fitness Center. In the next six months, our goal is to offer after school classes to kids (ages 7-14). Once our initial program ramps up, we want to offer “fitness scholarships” to kids in the area whose parents may not be able to afford our pricing. 

Please check out our perks to the right, and be sure to use the share buttons at the top of the page.  There are also lots of other ways to help at the bottom of the page if you choose not to contribute financially.

*Help ensure that local money fuels local business*

Other Ways You Can Help:

Besides contributing financially, there's a lot you can to help with our campaign:

* Email links for this IndieGoGo fundraising page to your family, friends and anyone else you think might want to help a local, family-owned business remain a part of this Brooklyn Community.

* Help us spread the word! Post links to this fundraising page on your Facebook, Instagram and Twitter accounts. This makes a HUGE difference! The more people who learn about this, the better chance we have of raising the funds we need. Even strangers contribute - so it's super important to share this link!

*For those who are not technically savvy, or even the folks glued to phones and computers... word of mouth is the most powerful. Spreading news about our gym throughout your day can be a huge help. Referrals are a great small business driver and one of the most effective ways to introduce new customers to our local business.  

If anyone has tips to help us get a business loan or secure an investor please reach out to us! We are actively exploring both routes but are open to suggestions and connections to help make this happen.

To our members, we are incredibly amazed by all of you and we appreciate your support, kind words and great reviews.

THANK YOU ALL FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!

In love and health,

The Hurst Family
